MsgEn: A Foreign Arisen, huh? As an Area Master, let me give you some advice.

MsgJp:
《<SPOT 945>》に新手の魔物が
出現したらしい
近くを通る時は警戒を怠らぬよう
気を引き締めることだ
MsgEn:
It seems that a new type of enemy has appeared in《<SPOT 945>》. 
When passing by nearby, be sure not to neglect your vigilance and remain on high alert.

MsgJp:
《<SPOT 945>》についてはもちろん問題だが
最近はこのキンガル全域で
魔族が活性化してきている節もある――
MsgEn:
Regarding 《<SPOT 945>》, of course, there are issues. 
However, recently, there seems to be an invigoration of Fiends throughout the entire region of Kingal.

MsgJp:
我々としても、どうにか遺跡に踏み込んで
調査を行いたいところだが、封印が施されている
場所もあって手を付けられないでいるのだ
MsgEn: As for us, we would like to somehow enter the ruins and conduct investigations, but there are places that have been sealed and we cannot touch them.

MsgJp:
村の内では若者たちの不満がくすぶり
村の外では魔物が着々とその勢力を
広めている――悩ましいことだ
MsgEn: Within the village, the dissatisfaction of the young people smolders, while outside the village, the enemy steadily expands its influence - a troubling situation.

MsgJp:
異国の覚者よ
貴君、この村の者に
何かと話しかけているのか？
MsgEn:
Oh, wise one from a foreign land.
Are you speaking to the people of this village about something?

MsgJp:
――いや、俺から何か言うことではないが
オイングスが貴君に話したいことが
あるそうだ
MsgEn: Well, it's not for me to say, but it seems that Oengus has something he wants to talk to you about.

MsgJp:
話を聞いてやってもらえるのなら
もう一度俺に話しかけてくれ
取り次がせてもらおう
MsgEn: If you can listen to my story, please talk to me again, and I'll make sure to pass it on.

MsgJp:
そういえば、異国の覚者よ――
先日はオイングスの頼みを聞いてもらったそうだな
MsgEn: By the way, esteemed Arisen from a foreign land, I heard that you recently helped Oengus with a request.

MsgJp:
どうやらヤツも最初は秘密にしたかったようだが
キンガルに異変が起きているかもしれない、と
打ち明けてきたのだ
MsgEn: It seems that he also wanted to keep it a secret at first, but he confided in me that there may be a disturbance in Kingal.

MsgJp:
俺からも族長として礼を言おう
村の危機を救ってくれて感謝する
MsgEn:
I, as the chief, shall also express my gratitude.
Thank you for saving the village from crisis.

MsgJp:
――異なる竜に仕えているというのに
フィンダムにも救いの手を差し伸べてくれるとは
貴君も人が良いのだな
MsgEn:
To think that even while serving different dragons, you would extend a helping hand to Phindym. 
You truly are a kind-hearted person.

MsgJp:
ひとつ――
聞き流してくれて構わんのだが
少し耳を貸してくれないだろうか
MsgEn:
One thing――
I don't mind if you just let it pass you by, but could you lend me your ear for a moment?

MsgJp:
《<SPOT 911>》から魔物が這い出して
きているという報告が入ってきている
どうしても中を改めねばならん時がきているようだ
MsgEn:
We have received reports that monsters are crawling out from《<SPOT 911>》. 
It seems that the time has come when we absolutely need to make changes inside.

MsgJp:
異国の者を頼るということに
村の内部ではまだ抵抗する者が多い――
しかし、フィンダムの覚者が不在である今
頼れるのは貴君しかいないのだ
MsgEn:
There are still many within the village who resist the idea of relying on outsiders. 
However, with the absence of Phindym's Arisen, you are the only one we can depend on right now.

MsgJp:
もし貴君さえよければ
かの遺跡の内部を調べてきて
もらえないだろうか――
意にそわねば、聞かなかったことにしてくれ
MsgEn:
If you're willing, could you investigate the interior of that ancient ruin? 
If you don't feel like it, you can pretend you didn't hear it.

MsgJp:
この考えは最近確信に変わったのだが
貴君は――心からの良心によって
グリンデュアを救おうとしてくれているのだな
MsgEn: This belief has turned into a conviction for me recently, and you... you're trying to save Glyndwr with all your heart.

MsgJp:
確かに、この未曾有の危機にあって
我らの覚者に頼ることもできないとあっては
貴君の助けを受け入れた方がよいだろう
MsgEn:
Certainly, in this unprecedented crisis, we can't rely on our Arisen.
It would be better to accept your help.

MsgJp:
――ここは考え込んではいられない
俺は、このグリンデュアの族長として
正式に貴君の助けを請うことにしよう
MsgEn: I cannot afford to hesitate here. As the chief of Glyndwr, I have decided to formally request your assistance.

MsgJp:
村人の中にはまだ貴君のことを
受け入れられない者も多いかもしれないが
どうか、大目に見てやってほしい
MsgEn: There may still be many villagers who cannot accept you, but please, be understanding.

MsgJp:
過去を守ることで存続してきた村なのだ
そう簡単に全てを変えられるわけではない――
だが、過去に囚われ前進を拒む姿勢は
俺が正してゆこう
MsgEn:
This village has endured by upholding its past. 
It's not so simple to change everything, but I will rectify the mindset that refuses to move forward, bound by the past.

MsgJp:
なんといっても、文句を言う者たちも
《<SPOT 947>》に現れた魔物を
打ち倒す力を持ってはいないのだから――
MsgEn: After all, those who complain don't have the power to defeat the demons that appeared at <SPOT 947>, so –

MsgJp:
あの場に魔物がとどまっているせいで
南東の遺跡の調査に進めない状態なのだ
MsgEn: We can't continue with the investigation of the southeastern ruins because monsters are lingering at that site.

MsgJp:
《<SPOT 947>》の近くを通ることがあれば
魔物を追い払ってくれるよう
頼めないだろうか
MsgEn: If you happen to pass by near <SPOT 947>, could you please help drive away the monsters?

MsgJp:
貴君はこの村において
どんどん理解者を増やしているようだな
MsgEn: My lord, it seems that you are steadily increasing the number of understanding individuals in this village.

MsgJp:
先日、シェドレアン大神殿前の橋の
修繕が終わったのは知っているか？
実は、そこへ魔族が現れ
いまだ通行が難しくなっている
MsgEn:
Did you know that the repairs on the bridge in front of the Shadolean Great Temple were completed the other day? 
Actually, fiends have appeared there, making it still difficult to pass through.

MsgJp:
この件について、ボーデシアが
貴君に言いたいことがあるというのだ
MsgEn: Boadicea has something to tell you about this matter.

MsgJp:
今まで若者との間に軋轢を生んでいた
ボーデシアでさえ、貴君に話がしたいと
いうのだから大したものだな――
MsgEn: Even Boadicea, who has been causing tension among the young people, wants to talk to you – that's quite something.

MsgJp:
ああ、ボーデシアに話をしに行くのであれば
俺にもう一度話しかけてほしい
責任を持って取り次がせてもらおう
MsgEn: Ah, if you're going to talk to Boadicea, please talk to me again. I'll make sure to relay it responsibly.

MsgJp:
異国の覚者よ、聞いてほしい――
《<SPOT 912>》はこのキンガルに
おいてもかなり大規模な遺跡だ
MsgEn: Listen, foreign Arisen. <SPOT 912> is quite a large ruin even here in Kingal.

MsgJp:
しかし、実はここについても
気軽に調査ができるわけではないのだ
なんといっても、入口は厳重に封印されている
MsgEn:
However, the truth is that you can't just casually investigate this place. 
After all, the entrance is securely sealed.

MsgJp:
《<SPOT 912>》は元々神殿として
使われていた遺跡――
MsgEn: <SPOT 912> was originally an ancient ruin that served as a Temple.

MsgJp:
恐らくその場で働いていたと思われる
巫女が《<SPOT 913>》に葬られている
MsgEn: It is believed that the shrine maiden who was probably working there is buried at <SPOT 913>.

MsgJp:
彼女の墓である《<SPOT 913>》を
調査することで、封印を解く
手がかりが得られるはずだ
MsgEn: By investigating her grave at <SPOT 913>, you should be able to find clues to break the seal.

MsgJp:
我々も調査隊を出そうとは思っているが
まずは貴君に先行して魔物を討ち倒しておいて
もらいたいのだ――頼めるだろうか
MsgEn:
We are also planning to send out an investigation team, but first, we would like you to take the lead and defeat the enemies.
Can we count on you for this?

MsgJp:
先日は世話になった――
貴君に《<SPOT 913>》へ先行してもらった
おかげで、後続の調査隊は安全に
調査に集中できたという
MsgEn:
I am grateful for your assistance the other day. 
Thanks to you, the subsequent investigation team was able to safely concentrate on their investigation after you went ahead to <SPOT 913>.

MsgJp:
さらに、その時の調査によって
《<SPOT 912>》の封印を解くための
手がかりをえることができたのだ
MsgEn: Furthermore, through the investigation at that time, we were able to obtain clues to unlock the seal of <SPOT 912>,

MsgJp:
――だが、悪い知らせもある
封印を解こうとしている動きを
魔物たちに察知されたようだ
MsgEn:
However, there is also bad news. 
It seems that the movement to release the seal has been detected by the enemy monsters.

MsgJp:
《<SPOT 949>》に魔族が現れ
我々の行く手を阻んでいる
それどころか、この村に侵攻しようとする
動きすらあるのだ
MsgEn:
Fiends have appeared in 《<SPOT 949>》, blocking our path.
Not only that, they are even trying to invade this village.
There is movement, indeed.

MsgJp:
異国の――いや、白き竜の覚者よ
我々が封印を解かんとしている間
湧き出でる魔族を討伐してほしい――
MsgEn:
O Arisen of the White Dragon,
While we are in the process of unsealing, We ask that you subdue the surging Fiends.

MsgJp:
うまくいけば、あと少しで
この騒動にも決着がつくはずなのだ――
MsgEn: If all goes well, there should be a resolution to this turmoil soon—just a little further to go.

MsgJp:
白き竜の覚者よ――
よい頃合いに来てくれた！
MsgEn:
Oh, Arisen of the White Dragon!
You have come at a good time!

MsgJp:
かねてより封印を解かんと励んでいた
《<SPOT 912>》の封印を
ついに解くことができたのだ！
MsgEn: We've been diligently working to unlock the seal at "<SPOT 912>", and we have finally succeeded!

MsgJp:
どうか、かの神殿に赴き
魔族が活性化した理由を
探ってきてもらえないだろうか
MsgEn: Please, visit the Temple and investigate the reason behind the Fiends' resurgence.

MsgJp:
引き受けてもらえるのなら
あの辺りの事情について詳しい者を
貴君に紹介しよう
準備ができたら俺に話しかけてくれ
MsgEn:
If you're willing to take on the task, I'll introduce someone who knows the situation in that area well. 
When you're ready, talk to me.

MsgJp:
グリンデュアの様子を見にきてくれたのか
ありがたいことだ――
MsgEn:
Did you come to see the state of Glyndwr?
I appreciate it.

MsgJp:
あれ以来は静かなものだ――
侵食という災いはいまだ大地をむしばんでいるが
忌まわしい魔族に脅かされることはない
MsgEn:
Since then, it has been quiet—
Though the calamity of corruption still gnaws at the land,
We are not threatened by the loathsome fiends.

MsgJp:
貴君には続けて世話になったな
この辺りに来た時は、今日のように
ぜひ村に寄ってくれ
MsgEn:
I have relied on your kind assistance for some time now.
When you come to this area, please be sure to visit the village.

MsgJp:
グリンデュアは貴君のために
より質の良い支援品を集めておくことを
約束しよう
MsgEn:
Glyndwr promises to gather better-quality support items for you. 
It's thanks to your help that we were able to recapture the Thines fort, after all.

MsgJp:
白き竜の覚者よ――
実は、グリンデュアはまたも
魔族の脅威にさらされているのだ――
MsgEn: Arisen of the White Dragon, Glyndwr is once again threatened by the forces of darkness.

MsgJp:
《シェレドアン大神殿》は一因にすぎないと
すれば、どこかに魔族がやってくる
元凶となる場があるはずなのだが――
今のところ見つかっていない
MsgEn:
The "Shadolean Great Temple" is only one factor. 
There must be a place where the demons come from, the root cause. 
But it hasn't been found yet.

MsgJp:
過去の文献をあたることで手がかりが
つかめるかと、文献が多数残されている小塔への
門を開けることにした
MsgEn:
By accessing past records, we hope to find clues. 
So, I decided to open the gate to the small tower, where numerous documents have been preserved.

MsgJp:
また、このキンガル峡谷のため
手を貸してはもらえないだろうか――
MsgEn: Could you lend a hand for the Kingal Canyon too?

MsgJp:
白き竜の覚者よ
どうか聞いてほしい――
MsgEn: Oh, Arisen of the White Dragon, I hope you will listen...

MsgJp:
キンガル峡谷北部には
《<SPOT 914>》という
大規模な遺跡があるのだが――
MsgEn: In the northern part of Kingal Canyon, there's a large ruin called "<SPOT 914>," but –

MsgJp:
実は、その遺跡を中心に強力な魔物が
徘徊しているという情報が入ってきているのだ
MsgEn: In fact, there is information that powerful enemies are wandering around the ruins.

MsgJp:
我が村の者が魔物と対峙しても
生きて戻ってくることは難しいだろう――
覚者よ、どうかその白き竜の加護によって
魔物を打ち払ってもらえないだろうか
MsgEn:
It is difficult for our villagers to confront the enemy and return alive. 
Arisen, would you please help drive away the enemies with the protection of the White Dragon?

MsgJp:
――《<SPOT 914>》の近くには
《<SPOT 959>》という
人の住まう塔がある
MsgEn: Near <SPOT 914>, there is a tower inhabited by people called <SPOT 959>.

MsgJp:
かの塔に暮らす人々は独自の文化を持つため
交流になかなかの難しさがあるのだが――
MsgEn: The people who live in that Tower have their own unique culture, so there are quite a few difficulties in communication.

MsgJp:
昨今の魔族出現の件にて交渉を重ね、拠点として
門戸を開放するよう約束を取り付けた
MsgEn: Through repeated negotiations regarding the recent appearance of Fiends, a promise was secured to open the gates and establish a Hall as a base.

MsgJp:
恐らく住民には歓迎されないだろうとは思うが
《<SPOT 959>》を調査の足場として
あるいは旅の疲れを癒すため
役立ててほしい――
MsgEn: It probably won't be welcomed by the residents, but you can use <SPOT 959> as a base for your investigations or to rest from your travels.

MsgJp:
魔物の討伐を引き受けてもらえるなら
俺にその件を話しかけてくれ
詳しく説明しよう
MsgEn:
If you can take on the task of subduing monsters, please approach me about that matter. 
I'll explain it in detail.

MsgJp:
貴君には度々力を貸してもらっているというのに
不甲斐ないことだが、状況は悪化の
一路を辿るばかりだ――
MsgEn:
I've had you lend your strength many times, and I'm sorry for my ineffectiveness. 
The situation is only getting worse.

MsgJp:
とうとう、これまで儀式に使われていた場にまで
侵食魔の姿が確認されるように
なってしまった――
MsgEn: Finally, the appearance of the Corruption has been confirmed in the very place where rituals were held.

MsgJp:
《<SPOT 953>》――元は大地に
季節の感謝を表す舞踊を奉じる場だったのだ
最近は魔物の凶暴性が高まったがゆえに
安全を考えて中止されていたが――
MsgEn:
《<SPOT 953>》――Originally, it was a place to perform a dance that expressed gratitude for seasons of the earth.
Recently, it has been cancelled for safety reasons due to the increased aggression of the enemies.

MsgJp:
侵食は大地だけではなく
我々の文化も蝕んでゆくという一例なのだろうな
――もっと早くに対処していれば――
MsgEn:
Corruption not only consumes the land, but also serves as an example of how it erodes our culture.
If only we had dealt with it sooner...

MsgJp:
今まで立ち入りを禁じていた
《<SPOT 915>》も
もはや封鎖している意味はないだろう
MsgEn: There is now no longer any meaning in continuing to block off <SPOT 915> that was previously prohibited from being entered.

MsgJp:
封鎖はすでに解いてある――
もしも貴君の調査によって
何らかの手がかりとなるようであれば
ぜひ調べてみてくれ――
MsgEn: The seal has already been broken. If your investigation could provide any clues, please examine it.

MsgJp:
来てくれてよかった――
こちらから貴君へ遣いを出そうかと
思案していたところだ
MsgEn: I'm glad you came. I was considering sending someone to you to discuss matters.

MsgJp:
先ほど判明したのだが、小塔に収められた
書物に“スカージ”の名があったのだ
――強大な悪魔の名前だ
MsgEn:
I found out earlier that the book stored in the small tower has the name "Scourge." 
It's the name of a powerful demon.

MsgJp:
今まで魔族が無尽蔵に襲来していたのは
スカージが呼び寄せていたせいだろう
MsgEn: The reason why the fiends have been invading endlessly until now is probably because of the Scourge calling them.

MsgJp:
今、あの強大な魔物に太刀打ちできるのは
白き竜の覚者――貴君だけだろう
どうか、ヤツを討ってくれないだろうか
MsgEn: Now, the one who can confront that mighty demon is the White Dragon's Arisen – perhaps you can defeat it for us?

MsgJp:
今までの敵とは違う、あまりにも
危険すぎる相手だ――
無理にとは言えない――
MsgEn: This is a different kind of danger from the enemies we've faced so far – it's not something we can force.

MsgJp:
だが、もし――
もしも、此度も力を貸してくれるのであれば
再び俺に声をかけてほしい――
MsgEn: However, if... if you are willing to lend your strength again this time, please call on me once more.

MsgJp:
おお、白き竜の覚者よ――
よく来てくれた
MsgEn:
Oh, Arisen of the White Dragon ――
Thank you for coming.

MsgJp:
侵食という未曾有の災害に見舞われたフィンダム
その中でも、さらに魔族の脅威に繰り返し
さらされたグリンデュアが――今もこうして
あるのは全て貴君の力添えあってこそ
MsgEn: Phindym, which was struck by the unprecedented disaster of Corruption, and Glyndwr, who has been repeatedly exposed to the threat of the Fiends, is still here today, thanks to all your support.

MsgJp:
これまでの礼として
今後、貴君への支給品の質をより向上させる
ことを決定した
MsgEn: As a token of gratitude so far, we have decided to improve the quality of supplies to you in the future.

MsgJp:
これは俺だけではなく
このグリンデュアの民の総意だ
どうか受け取ってくれ
MsgEn: This is not just from me, but the unanimous decision of the people of Glyndwr. Please accept it.

MsgJp:
白き竜の覚者よ
きっと来てくれるものと思っていた
MsgEn: Oh, Arisen of the White Dragon, I believed that you would surely come.

MsgJp:
今、フィンダムに覚者はいない
セシリーが覚者としてすごしていたならば
――いや、こんなことを言ってもしようがないな
MsgEn:
Currently, there are no Arisen in Phindym. 
If Cecily had lived as an Arisen...
No, there's no point in saying such things.

MsgJp:
みな不安がっている
もし、時間があればだが――
頼りに思う貴君に声をかけられれば、少しは
気も安らぐことだろう
MsgEn: Everyone is feeling anxious. If you have the time, it would be reassuring for us if you, whom we rely on, could lend us your voice.

MsgJp:
ガラダがフィンダム中の族長に
いち早く連携を提案してくれた
これは、先日の危機を乗り越えた賜物といえるな
MsgEn:
Gearóid reached out to the chieftains of Phindym, proposing cooperation swiftly. 
This is truly a testament to overcoming the recent crisis.

MsgJp:
ああ――異国の覚者ね
何の用かしら
MsgEn: Oh, you're an Arisen from a foreign land. What do you need?

MsgJp:
ここまで来るのに疲れたって？
一眠りすれば楽になるんじゃない
ここに泊まるなら<VAL PRICE_INN>だけど
泊まっていくの？
MsgEn:
You're tired from coming all this way? 
Maybe you'll feel better after a nap. 
If you're staying here, it's <VAL PRICE_INN>. Are you going to stay?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
疲れてるんなら
ホラ、寝床好きに使っていいから――
で、休んでいくの？
MsgEn:
If you're tired, well, you can use my bed if you want――
So, are you going to rest?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
――《弱化の治療》なら
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>よ
まぁ、どうするかは自分次第ね
治療していく？
MsgEn:
If it's Treat Weakness, it's <VAL PRICE_WEAK>.
Well, it's up to you what to do.
Shall we proceed with the treatment?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
なんだ、弱化してないじゃない
眠いんなら泊まっていきなさいよ
腹が減ってるならシェナの料理を
食べていくといい
MsgEn:
What, you haven't weakened, have you? 
If you're tired, why don't you stay the night? 
And if you're hungry, it's best to eat Shena's cuisine.

MsgJp:
あたしはココを切り盛りしてるだけよ
エリアの情報はキアランに聞くのね
MsgEn:
I'm just managing this place.
If you want information about the area, ask Ciarán.

MsgJp:
キアランはやたら考えこむクセがあるわ
聞きたいことがあるなら要点を絞って聞くことね
じゃないと、話が長くなるから
MsgEn:
Ciarán has a habit of overthinking.
If you have something you want to ask, make it concise.
Otherwise, the conversation will drag on.

MsgJp:
ん？
キアランはあたしのダンナよ
MsgEn:
Huh?
Ciarán is my husband.

MsgJp:
考え込むのが好きで、素早く物事を決めないから
拠点の中のことはあたしが回した方が
効率がいいの
MsgEn: Because I enjoy pondering and don't make quick decisions, it's more efficient for me to handle matters within the base.

MsgJp:
少し休んでいく？
疲れた顔のままではここから出せないわね
MsgEn:
Are you going to take a little rest?
You can't go out from here with such a tired face.

MsgJp:
キアランはやたら考え込むでしょう
だから、今は立ち止まって考えるのをやめて
村の皆がいつも通り暮らせるようにってことにだけ
集中するように言ったのよ
MsgEn:
Ciarán tends to ponder a lot, doesn't he? 
That's why I told him to stop and not think too much for now. 
Just concentrate on ensuring that everyone in the village can live as usual.

MsgJp:
それぞれが怯えて
妙なことをし始めないようにね
MsgEn: So that each person does not start doing strange things out of fear.

MsgJp:
怖くないといえば嘘になる
でも、眠っているとはいえ精霊竜セシリーがいて
こうして異国の人たちも来てくれてる
MsgEn:
To say that it's not scary would be a lie.
But even though she's asleep, Spirit Dragon Cecily is here.
And we also have people from foreign lands like this who have come.

MsgJp:
それに、あたしにはキアランがいる
キアランにはあたしが付いてる
――きっと、それほど悪くないわ
MsgEn: And, I have Ciarán, and Ciarán has me. Surely, it's not that bad.

MsgJp:
ダナが戦士を出してくれたって聞いてるわ
きっとあたしたち、“前の騒動”の時よりかは
結束できているのよね
MsgEn: I heard Dana has sent out warriors. I'm sure we're more united than during the "previous incident."

MsgJp: よっ、色々見ていってくれ
MsgEn: Hey, go ahead and take a look at various things.

MsgJp: 何で“大人”って怖がりなんだろうな
MsgEn: I wonder why "adults" are always afraid.

MsgJp:
あのさ、この村で建設的な話ができるのは
マヴェイル兄貴だけだぜ！
――俺はそう思ってる！
MsgEn: Listen, there's no one else in this village I can have a constructive conversation with except for my big brother Mavail. That's what I think.

MsgJp:
“立派な大人”たちは、ほら――
頭が固いんだよな
ああはなりたくないよ
MsgEn: "Respected adults" are often quite stubborn. I hope I don't become like that.

MsgJp:
あ、ああ
覚者さんか、いらっしゃい
MsgEn: Oh, you're an Arisen! Welcome.

MsgJp:
キアランが普段通り店を開けろっていうから
こうしてるけどさぁ――
MsgEn: Because Ciarán told me to open the shop as usual, I'm doing it like this, you know...

MsgJp:
大変なことになったって、頭ではわかってるんだけど
いまいち実感が無いんだ――悪い冗談みたいでさ
かと思えば、急にものすごく怖くなる
どうしたらいいのかな
MsgEn:
I know in my head that things have become really difficult, but I can't quite grasp the reality of it—it feels like a bad joke.
And then suddenly, I become incredibly scared.
What should I do?

MsgJp:
あのさ――これで終わりなんかじゃないよな
フィンダムは――まだ、なんとかなるよな
頼むよ、そうだって言ってくれ
MsgEn: Hey, you know... this can't be the end, right? Phindym... there has to be a way. Please, tell me it's true.

MsgJp:
呼んだかい！
さっ、何が食べたい？
MsgEn:
Have you called for me? 
Well then, what would you like to eat?

MsgJp:
さぁさぁ、お腹いっぱい食べとくれ！
覚者さんも体が資本でしょ
食べて力付けなきゃ！
MsgEn:
Come on, come on, eat until your belly is full! 
Even the Arisen relies on their body. 
You have to eat and gain strength!

MsgJp: 何だい、好き嫌いしちゃダメだよ！
MsgEn: What's wrong? You can't be picky!

MsgJp:
ガッカリきた時、活力が出ない時――
そんな時は美味しいものを食べるのが一番だよ！
さ、何が食べたい？
MsgEn:
When you're disappointed, when you lack vitality――
The best thing to do is eat something delicious!
So, what do you want to eat?

MsgJp:
覚者さん、お腹いっぱい食べてっとくれ！
こんな時だからこそ、食べるのを
おろそかにしちゃいけないんだから！
MsgEn:
Arisen, please eat until you're full!
Especially at times like this, you shouldn't neglect to eat
!

MsgJp:
明日この世が終わるってわけでもないんだろう？
だったら、今日食べて、明日も食べなきゃ
毎日美味しいものを作るからさ――
MsgEn:
This world isn't ending tomorrow, is it?
So, let's eat today and tomorrow too, I'll make something delicious every day――

MsgJp:
空を見たかって？
――見たくないから、見てないよ
変に見ちゃったら怖くなるかもしれないからね
MsgEn:
You want to look at the sky? 
Well, I haven't looked because I might get scared if I see something strange.

MsgJp:
みんな、お腹いっぱい食べれば
少しは落ち着くと思うんだけど
緊張しちゃって食べる気にならないみたい
MsgEn: Everyone might feel a bit calmer if they eat their fill, but it seems they're too nervous to eat.

MsgJp: 同行者を探したいなら手を貸そう
MsgEn: If you want to find a companion, let me help you.

MsgJp:
遺跡には近寄るなよ
村の者にはよく言い聞かせてある
異国の覚者とて例外ではない
MsgEn: Don't approach the ruins. I've made it clear to the villagers. Even foreign Arisen are not exceptions.

MsgJp:
自分が異国から来たからといって
ここの掟を軽んじないことだ
MsgEn: Just because you're from a foreign land doesn't mean you should disregard the rules here.

MsgJp:
遺跡に近づく者あらば災いが起こる――
そう言い伝えられているのだ
MsgEn: Trouble is said to befall those who approach the ruins. This is a well-established belief.

MsgJp:
先人の知恵を無視して
村の平穏は無い
MsgEn: Ignoring the wisdom of our ancestors, the village knows no peace.

MsgJp: ううむ――
MsgEn: Hmm...

MsgJp:
あの渦、まるでこの世の災いという災いを
かき集めたかのような禍禍しさだ
MsgEn: That vortex, it exudes a calamitous intent, as if gathering all the misfortunes of this world.

MsgJp:
用が無いなら話しかけるな
今は気軽に話していられる状況ではない
MsgEn:
If you have no business, do not talk to me.
It is not a situation where we can speak casually right now.

MsgJp:
フィンダムは災い続きだ
やはり、言い伝えを――先人の知恵を
無視したからこうなっているのでは――
そう考えるのも当然のことだと思わないか
MsgEn:
Phindym has been plagued by disasters. 
It's natural to think that it's because they ignored traditions and wisdom passed down by their ancestors.

MsgJp: ――何か用でも？
MsgEn: Yes, may I help you with something?

MsgJp:
遺跡には近付くことなかれ――
これは昔からこの村に伝わる掟だ
近付いたら、村に一体どんな災いが起こるか――
MsgEn:
Do not approach the ruins――
This is a rule that has been passed down in this village since ancient times.
If you approach, what kind of disaster will befall the village――

MsgJp:
その昔、神殿に足を踏み入れた者がいたそうな――
無事に神殿を出ることはできたんだが
安心して後ろを振り返った瞬間――
MsgEn:
In the old days, it is said that someone set foot in the temple. 
They managed to get out safely, but the moment they relaxed and looked back—

MsgJp:
神殿の入り口から伸びた巨大な腕に
ズバーッと頭から切り裂かれた！！
MsgEn: A massive arm extended from the temple entrance and slashed them right through, from the head first!!

MsgJp:
――という話もあるんだぞ
古い場所には近寄らないことだ
MsgEn: There's a saying that you shouldn't approach the old places.

MsgJp:
――お前さん
自分だけは強いから
遺跡の災いも怖くないと思ってるんじゃないか？
思い上がりだぞ、それは
MsgEn:
You think you're invincible because you believe that the danger of the ruins doesn't scare you? 
That's just arrogance.

MsgJp:
あの渦を見ろ！
はやくどうにかしてくれ！
MsgEn: Look at that vortex! Please, do something about it soon!

MsgJp:
こんな空は見たことがない
ああ、一生見たくなかった！
MsgEn: I've never seen a sky like this. Oh, I wish I'd never seen it!

MsgJp:
とんでもないことになるぞ――
災いだ、きっとこれこそが遺跡の災いだ！
MsgEn: This is going to be a major disaster, I'm sure of it! A calamity! It must be the disaster of the ruins!

MsgJp:
どこかに逃げないといけないんじゃないか？
キアランは落ち着くべきだと言っていたが
本当は自分たちだけ逃げるつもりなんじゃ――？
く、口ではなんとでも言えるぞ
MsgEn:
Do we need to escape somewhere?
Ciarán said we should calm down, but are we really planning to escape on our own?
Hah, you can say anything with your mouth, can't you?

MsgJp: ああ、異国の覚者さんか
MsgEn: Ah, an Arisen from a foreign land.

MsgJp:
もっと遠くに採掘に行けたらなぁ――
村も潤うし、いいこと尽くめなのにな――
MsgEn:
If only we could go mining further away—
The village would prosper, and it would be all good.—

MsgJp:
この村では遠出は禁じられているんだ
俺の脚なら遠出しても
その日のうちに帰ってこられるのに――
MsgEn:
In this village, going far is prohibited.
Even if it's a long journey, with my legs, I can return home within the same day--

MsgJp: 覚者さんも何か言われなかったかい
MsgEn: Did the Arisen not say something as well, my Lord?

MsgJp:
遺跡に近寄るなー、災いがふりかかるぞー
――とかさ
MsgEn:
Don't get too close to the ruins, disaster will strike.
Or so they say...

MsgJp:
来てくれたのか！
覚者さんの顔を見たら、何だかほっとしたよ
MsgEn: You came! When I saw the face of the Arisen I felt relieved for some reason.

MsgJp:
ダナが精鋭の戦士を出してくれたらしい
あの渦の真下の辺りに向かったんだろう
偉そうな奴らが多い村だと思ってたけど
意外と頼りになるんだな
MsgEn:
It seems that Dana sent out elite soldiers. 
They must have headed towards the area right below that vortex. 
I thought this village was full of arrogant people, but they unexpectedly turned out to be dependable.

MsgJp:
今は遠出する気にならないよ
できるだけ家族の近くにいたい
万が一の時に、傍にいたいからさ
MsgEn:
Right now, I don't feel like going far away.
I want to be close to my family as much as possible.
In case something happens, I want to be by their side.

MsgJp:
アデリンは――
こんな時でも物見台か
後で迎えに行ってやらないと
MsgEn: Adelin, even in times like these, you're still at the observatory, huh? I'll have to go pick you up later.

MsgJp: ――なんでしょう？
MsgEn: ...What is it?

MsgJp:
遺跡に近づこうなんて思わないでくださいね
あなただけじゃなく、村に災いが
降りかかったらどうするんです
MsgEn:
Please refrain from approaching the ruins. 
Not only you, but if the village were to suffer a disaster, what would you do?

MsgJp:
わたしはね、ビックリするようなことは
何一つ望んでないんですよ
良いことも悪いこともね
MsgEn: You know, I don't wish for anything surprising at all, whether it's something good or something bad.

MsgJp:
何事も無いのが一番――
だから、外から何かを持ちこまないでくださいね
MsgEn:
Nothing happening is the best of all. 
So, please don't bring anything from the outside.

MsgJp:
若い時は刺激を欲しがりますけどね
何かが変わるのが良いか悪いかなんて
誰も正確に予測できませんよ
MsgEn: When you're young, you often seek excitement, but whether it's for better or worse, no one can predict what will change.

MsgJp:
悪い方にいったらどうするんです
今のままで十分――
MsgEn: What if it goes wrong? Things are fine as they are now.

MsgJp:
ああ、怖い、どうしましょう
この気味が悪い空の色――
MsgEn: Ah, this is scary. What should we do about this eerie sky color?

MsgJp:
精霊竜セシリーはどうしてまだ目覚めないのかしら
フィンダムが大変なのよ！
どんな理由があったって、眠っている場合じゃないわ
MsgEn:
Why hasn't Spirit Dragon Cecily awakened yet?
Phindym is in great trouble!
No matter what the reason is, it's not the time to be sleeping.

MsgJp:
ただ平和に暮らしていきたいだけなのに――
どうしてこんなことになるの
MsgEn:
We just want to live in peace, yet...
Why did this happen?

MsgJp:
ねぇ、前みたいに
フィンダムを助けに来てくれたんでしょう？
それとも、わたしたちをどこかへ逃がすために
来てくれたんですか？
MsgEn:
Hey, did you come to help us like you did before?
Or did you come to take us somewhere and help us escape?

MsgJp: えっと、なぁに？
MsgEn: Um, what is it?

MsgJp: ママがあんまりよその人と話しちゃダメって――
MsgEn: Mom said I shouldn't talk to strangers...

MsgJp:
ほんとは、村の外の話を
聞かせて欲しいんだけど――
MsgEn:
I actually want you to tell me stories
from outside the village, but...

MsgJp:
ねぇ、色んな村を見てきたんでしょう？
“芯なる樹”を近くで見たことはある？
MsgEn:
Hey, have you seen many villages?
Have you ever seen the Core Tree up close?

MsgJp:
村から出ちゃいけないって言われるけど
いつか色んなところに行ってみたいの
MsgEn: Although I'm told not to leave the village, I still have a strong desire to explore different places someday.

MsgJp:
大人になったら
もっと近くで“芯なる樹”を見にいけるかな――
MsgEn: When I become an adult, I wonder if I can go see the "Core Tree" up close...

MsgJp:
空の色が――
この色、きらい
MsgEn:
The color of the sky...
I don't like this color.

MsgJp:
“芯なる樹”はいつだってきれいだって
思ってたけど――この空の色だと
あんまりきれいに見えない――
MsgEn: I always thought the "Core Tree" was beautiful, but the sky's color doesn't make it look as pretty.

MsgJp:
空の渦、怖いのに
一度見始めるとずっと見ちゃうの
それでもっと怖くなるから――
もう見たくない
MsgEn:
I'm scared of the swirling vortex, but once I start watching, I can't stop. 
And that makes it even scarier – I don't want to see it anymore.

MsgJp:
空はまた元に戻る？
はやく戻ってくれないと、怖い夢を見そう
MsgEn: Will the sky return to normal? It needs to come back soon, or I'll have nightmares.

MsgJp:
塔の外からお越しとは――
用があるならお聞きしましょう
MsgEn: You've come from outside the tower? If you have business, I'll be happy to listen.

MsgJp:
宿泊をご希望なら<VAL PRICE_INN>です
ここは資源が限られていることもあり
旅人に大盤振る舞いというのはできないのです
それでも、よろしいですか？
MsgEn: If you're looking for accommodation, it's <VAL PRICE_INN>. We have limited resources here, so we can't afford to be extravagant with travelers. Is that acceptable to you?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
今は寝床に余裕があります
休みたいなら案内しましょうか？
MsgEn: There's plenty of room for a bed now. If you want to rest, shall I show you the way?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》には
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>いただきますよ
なにぶん、物資も限られていますからね
治療をお望みですか？
MsgEn: For the "Treat Weakness," the cost is <VAL PRICE_WEAK>. We have limited supplies, you see. Do you wish to receive treatment?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
弱化にはなっていませんよ
気のせい、ということです
よろしいですね
MsgEn:
You haven't been weakened, you know. 
It's just your imagination. Alright then, understood?

MsgJp:
どうして塔に住んでいるのか、ですか？
我らは守っているのです
この塔に住むことで――
MsgEn:
Why do we live in the tower?
We are here to protect it.
By living in this tower...

MsgJp:
何を守っているのかは――
長老のベレナスにでもお聞きください
我らは祖先より代々、この塔にて“守る”ために
ここにいると聞かされています
MsgEn:
What we are protecting, you should ask Elder Berenas about it. 
We have been told that we are here, generation after generation, to "protect" this tower.

MsgJp:
きっとダナの住人たちは
彼らの武勇が村を守っていると
思っているでしょうね
MsgEn: I'm sure the people of Dana think their bravery is protecting the village.

MsgJp:
私に言わせれば、ダナの侵食が
比較的ゆるやかなのは
村の位置が関係しているだけです
MsgEn: In my opinion, the relatively slow spread of corruption in Dana is solely due to the village's location.

MsgJp:
この場は私が取りまとめていますが
この《イヴァノスの塔》の成り立ちについては
長老のベレナスに聞いてください
MsgEn: I'm managing this place, but please ask Elder Berenas about the history of the Tower of Ivannos.

MsgJp:
彼が素直に話すとは思えませんが――
私たちですら、いつも煙に巻かれるのです
MsgEn: I don't think he'll speak candidly, but even we often get confused.

MsgJp: よぉ、買い物か？
MsgEn: Hey, are you here for shopping?

MsgJp:
ここの売り物も、皆で必死に集めてきたものだ
無駄遣いはするなよ
MsgEn:
The things being sold here are also items that we've desperately gathered together. 
Don't waste them, okay?

MsgJp:
外から来たところ悪いが、節約に協力してくれ
回復薬を次々に飲むより
仲間に回復してもらうようにするとか――
MsgEn:
I know you've come from the outside, but please cooperate with our efforts to save resources. 
Instead of consuming healing potions one after another, consider having your companions heal you.

MsgJp:
回復薬一つ仕入れるのに
どれだけ苦労してるか――
MsgEn: You have no idea how hard it is to get one bottle of healing potion...

MsgJp: あら？　なになに？
MsgEn: What? What, what?

MsgJp:
最近の皆、表情が固まっちゃってるわぁ――
なるようにしかならないんだから
考えても無駄無駄～
MsgEn:
Everyone seems to have stiff expressions these days. 
Well, there's no use in worrying when things will turn out how they will.

MsgJp:
なるようにしかならないし
逆に、なんだってなんとかなるのよ
どうしてかはわからないけど、きっとそうよ～
MsgEn:
It will turn out the way it's meant to be,
On the contrary, anything can be overcome somehow.
I don't know why, but surely that's how it is~

MsgJp:
あ、アナタにも眉間のシワが移っちゃってるわよ！
――なんちゃって、信じた？
MsgEn:
Ah, even you have wrinkles between your brows now!
Just kidding, did you believe me?

MsgJp:
これはこれは――
異なる竜に仕える方――
MsgEn:
Oh my, oh my――
One who serves a different dragon――

MsgJp:
この拠点の者は元々“塔を守る一族”――
知らず知らずの内に祖先の教えを受け継いでおる
MsgEn:
The people in this base are originally from the "family that protects the tower." 
Unknowingly, they've inherited the teachings of their ancestors.

MsgJp: “芯なる樹”のなりたちをお聞きになりたいと？
MsgEn: You want to hear about the origin of the Core Tree?

MsgJp:
この辺りの者は皆、子供の頃に聞かされる
たとえ話――その中に実は――
MsgEn: All the people around here are told a childhood fable—a story that, unbeknownst to them, holds a deeper truth.

MsgJp:
いや、異なる竜に仕える方にお話しすることでも
ありませんな――
MsgEn: No, there's no need to talk to the one who serves a different dragon. That's not it.

MsgJp:
幼い頃に親に聞かされる昔話、たとえ話――
いつまでも記憶の奥底に眠り続け
決して忘れ去られることの無いそれら――
真実が眠るにふさわしいでしょう
MsgEn:
The bedtime stories and allegories told to us by our parents when we were young, they continue to slumber deep in the depths of our memories.
Never to be forgotten, they are deserving of the truths that lie within.
Until eternity.

MsgJp: やぁ、調子はどうだい
MsgEn: Hello, how are you doing?

MsgJp:
グリンデュアにはよく行くよ
この辺りでは満足に資材を集められんからな
MsgEn:
I often go to Glyndwr.
Around here, it's hard to gather materials satisfactorily.

MsgJp:
――ちょっと頭が固い奴は多いけど
それはうちも同じだな
MsgEn: -There are quite a few stubborn people, but that's the same with us too.

MsgJp:
俺やダレンが集めてきた資材は
ギルロイが管理してくれている
欲しい物があれば彼に言ってくれ
MsgEn:
The materials that I and Darren have gathered are being managed by Gilroy.
If you want something, please let him know.

MsgJp:
――次に資材を集めに行く時に
欲しいものがあれば俺が取りまとめるんだが
アンタは自由に外に出られるもんな
MsgEn:
- When we go to gather materials next time, if there's anything you want, I'll handle it for you. 
Are you able to go outside freely?

MsgJp:
しかめっ面になっている者が多いだろう？
外の空気を吸ってみればいいのにな
MsgEn:
There are probably many people with frowns, aren't there?
They should try taking a breath of fresh air outside.

MsgJp:
よっ、調子どう？
外に行く準備するなら、手伝うよ
MsgEn: Hey, how are you? If you're preparing to go outside, I'll help you get ready.

MsgJp:
ライアムの仕事を手伝ってるんで
時々外の拠点に行くんだ
資材調達のついでにちょっと寄り道したりね
MsgEn:
I'm assisting Lyam with his work, so sometimes I go to other locations.
I might make a little detour while procuring materials.

MsgJp:
外のことを知るって気持ちいいもんだよ
気分転換になるし、何より楽しい
MsgEn:
It feels great to know about the outside world.
It's refreshing and above all, enjoyable.

MsgJp:
取引に行くのは主にグリンデュアだけど
ダナの方に行くこともあるんだ
MsgEn: The trade missions are mainly handled by Glyndwr, but we also go to Dana's side sometimes.

MsgJp:
ムキムキした人が多くて
なんていうか文化の違いを感じるよ
MsgEn: There are many muscular people here, and it feels like there are cultural differences.

MsgJp: ああ、レスタニアの覚者様でしたか――
MsgEn: Ah, so you are the Lord Arisen of Lestania――

MsgJp:
最近は侵食がフィンダム全体に
拡がっているそうですね
――ここに閉じこもるばかりでいいのかしら
MsgEn: It seems that the corruption is spreading throughout Phindym. Is it okay to just stay holed up here?

MsgJp:
ここに閉じこもって、一体何を成しているのか
疑問に思うこともあるんです――
でも、塔を守ることも大切だし――
MsgEn: Sometimes, I wonder what we're accomplishing by staying here, but protecting the tower is important too.

MsgJp:
この塔をお掃除して、きれいにして――
でも、外の大地はどんどん穢れて
いっているんでしょう？
MsgEn: You're cleaning and beautifying this tower, but I wonder if the outside world is getting more corrupted?

MsgJp:
ラスニテ一帯で困りごとか？
この辺りのことなら俺が相談に乗ろう
MsgEn:
Are you having trouble in the Rathnite Foothills?
If it's about this area, let me listen to your concerns.

MsgJp:
ん、誰だお前は？
見ない顔だ――
どこから来たのか明らかにしてもらおうか
MsgEn:
Hmm, who are you? You're not someone I know.
Let's find out where you came from.

MsgJp:
何だ、聞きたいことでもあるのか？
ラスニテ一帯について
俺のところに入ってきている情報なら
いくらでも話してやろう
MsgEn:
What's wrong? 
Do you have something you want to ask about the Rathnite area?
 If it's information that has come to me, I can tell you as much as you want.

MsgJp:
どうした？　様子を見に来てくれたのか？
せっかくだ、少し休んでいくといい
MsgEn:
What's the matter? Did you come to check on me?
Since you're here, it would be nice to take a little break.

MsgJp:
それにしても、お前もなぜ
ラスニテ山麓に立ち寄ろうと思ったんだ？
これと言って珍しいものも無い場所だろう
力になってもらえるのはありがたいが――
MsgEn:
But why did you also decide to stop by at the Rathnite Foothills? 
It's not a particularly unusual place. 
While it's appreciated that you're willing to help, it's quite unexpected for us.

MsgJp:
この状況で、疲れ切った者に
さらに無理をしろとは――俺は言えん――
動ける人間で動かねばならん
MsgEn:
To ask someone who's already exhausted in this situation to push even further – I can't say that. 
The ones who can move must move.

MsgJp:
せっかくだ、休息は十分取っていってくれ
魔物の襲撃を受けでもすれば
即座に叩き起こすから安心しろ
MsgEn:
Take your time and get plenty of rest. 
If the monsters attack, I'll wake you up immediately, so don't worry.

MsgJp:
悪しき竜、武装をはじめたオークども――
もはや手遅れであることは変わらんが
MsgEn: Evil dragons, armed orcs – it's too late, but...

MsgJp:
手慣らしができる場所ぐらいは教えてやろう
この村を出た川の向こう岸だ
MsgEn:
I will tell you at least a place where you can get some practice.
It's on the other side of the river, just outside this village.

MsgJp:
ああ、ここの設備は自由に使っていいが
外に出る時は注意しろよ
MsgEn: Ah, you are free to use the facilities here, but please be careful when going outside.

MsgJp:
――こんな状況だ
満足に支援品も出せんのだ
まぁ、無いよりはマシだろう
MsgEn:
-This is the situation we're in.
We can't even provide support goods properly.
Well, I guess it's better than nothing.

MsgJp:
そうだ、これを持っていけ
お前のお陰で、ここら辺でも
少しはマシな支援品が用意できるようになったぞ
MsgEn:
Oh, right, take this with you. 
Thanks to you, we've been able to prepare slightly better supplies around here.

MsgJp:
よく来てくれた！
お前に渡そうと思って取っておいた物だ
――これくらいの支援品は出せるくらい
状況は好転したということだ
MsgEn:
Welcome! I've kept something to give to you. 
It's support goods that I saved just for you!
I can provide this level of support now that the conditions have improved.

MsgJp:
お前らの存在が解放軍内で話題になっている――
一部の兵が再び魔軍に挑み始めたぐらいだ
悪いが力を貸してやってくれ
MsgEn:
Your existence is being talked about within the Liberation Army—
It's just that some soldiers have started challenging the Demon Army again, that's all.
I'm sorry, but could you lend us your strength?

MsgJp:
代わりといっちゃあ何だが――
いい素材が取れる場所を教えてやろう
廃村の近くだ、少しマシなもんを
身に付けるといい
MsgEn:
Well, I suppose it's not a bad idea to have a substitute... Let me tell you a place where you can find good materials. 
It's near an abandoned village, so you might find something a little better to equip yourself with.

MsgJp:
おう、たったいま厄介な知らせが入った
どうやら魔軍のヤツらが不穏な動きを
始めているようだ
MsgEn:
Oh, just received some troublesome news. 
It seems the Demon Army is starting to act suspiciously.

MsgJp:
早めに叩くか、まとめて叩くか
どう動くかはお前に任せる――
手が空いたら様子を見てきてくれ
MsgEn:
Should I strike early or strike all at once?
I leave it up to you to decide how to move--
When you have some free time, please come and see how things are going.

MsgJp:
今日はいい知らせだ
支援できるもんが増やせそうだ
なに、感謝されるほどのことでもない
MsgEn:
Today is good news.
It seems that there will be an increase in things I can support.
Well, it's not something deserving of much gratitude.

MsgJp:
驚いたことに
魔軍と解放軍の支配地が変わりつつある――
これが覚者の力ってやつなのか？
MsgEn: Surprisingly, the territories controlled by the Demon Army and the Liberation Army are changing... Is this the power of the Arisen?

MsgJp:
エリアの西側、ダクレイム砦の付近に
地下へと続く遺跡がある――
危険だが、行く価値のある場所だ
MsgEn:
To the west of the area, near Dacreim Fortress, there is a ruin that leads underground. 
It's dangerous, but it's worth a visit.

MsgJp:
おう、いいところに来てくれた――魔軍のヤツら
ロスギルの東でも、妙な動きをみせているようだ
頃合いを見てぶっ叩きに行ってくれ
MsgEn:
Ah, you've come to a good place - those guys from the Demon Army. 
Even in the east of Rothgill, they seem to be acting strangely. 
When the time is right, please go and smack them, hard.

MsgJp:
王子が――本当に還られるとは――
異国の覚者よ
ネド王子を助けてくれたこと、伏して感謝する！
MsgEn:
The prince... to think he would actually return. 
Foreign Arisen, I bow in gratitude for saving Prince Nedo!

MsgJp:
魔軍戦車カトブレパス――
ダクレイム砦の獣の将――
お前の力があればこの国の状況は変わるかも知れん
MsgEn:
Catoblepas, the War Tank of the Demon Army, and the Beast Master of Dacreim Fortress. 
With your power, the conditions in this country could potentially change.

MsgJp:
おう、来たか
盗賊団のアジトから北へ進んだところに
かなり古い地下水路があるのは知っているか
MsgEn:
Hey, you finally made it. 
Do you know about the pretty old underground waterways located north of the thieves' hideout?

MsgJp:
たちの悪い魔物どもの棲みかになってるが、
価値の高いものが採れることは間違いない
行くならしっかり準備してけよ
MsgEn:
It's become the den of nasty monsters, but there's no doubt valuable items can be found there. 
If you're going, make sure you're well-prepared.

MsgJp:
ついにこの話をする時が来たか――
この国を踏み荒らし、我が同胞たちの
命を奪ったあの憎き戦車――
MsgEn: The time has finally come to talk about this. The one who ravaged our country, the abominable tank that took the lives of our fellow compatriots.

MsgJp:
お前ならヤツを打ち倒せるかも知れん
心して聞いてくれ
MsgEn:
Maybe you can defeat that creature...
Listen carefully, with all your heart.

MsgJp:
たったあれだけの戦力で
あのカトブレパスを討伐してくるとは！
なんってやつだ、お前は――！
MsgEn:
To think you would defeat Catoblepas with such a small force! 
Who are you, anyway?!

MsgJp:
破滅までの時間をどう抗うか、って状況だった
この国に、お前は再び光を齎してくれた
ありがとう、覚者よ、いつでもお前を歓迎しよう！
MsgEn:
It was a situation of how to resist the time until destruction.
In this country, you have brought light once again.
Thank you, Arisen. We will always welcome you!

MsgJp:
なんだ、他のミッションへエントリー中のようだな
このミッションに出撃するというなら
今エントリーしているミッションを中止してくれ
でないと受け付けられんのだ
MsgEn:
What, it seems like you're currently in the midst of entering another mission. 
If you're going to sortie on this mission, please cancel the mission you're currently entering. 
Otherwise, I won't be able to accept it.

MsgJp:
休みたいのか？　ああ、いいとも！
<VAL PRICE_INN>だよ
すまないな、色々と苦しくてさ――
MsgEn:
Do you want a break? Oh, that's fine with me!
<VAL PRICE_INN>, you know.
Sorry, I've been going through various hardships...

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
皆疲れてるから
あまり長くは休んでもらえないが――
よかったら、少し休憩していくかい
MsgEn: Everyone is tired, so you can't rest for too long, but if you'd like, take a short break.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
あんたも大変みたいだな――
《弱化の治療》なら
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>だけど、いいかい
MsgEn: It seems like you're having a tough time too, huh? If it's "Treat Weakness," it will cost <VAL PRICE_WEAK>. Is that alright?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
弱化してないみたいだな
――つらい気持ちは分かるぜ
身体が重く沈んで、何にもしたくなくなる
そんな時は素直に休んだ方がいい
MsgEn:
It seems like you haven't weakened, huh?
- I understand the pain you're feeling.
When your body feels heavy and you don't feel like doing anything, it's better to honestly take a rest.

MsgJp:
調子はどうだ？
良くはなくても、悪くなきゃいいんだが
MsgEn:
How are you feeling?
It doesn't have to be good, as long as it's not bad.

MsgJp:
皆辛いのはわかるけど
沈んでたって仕方ないからな
MsgEn: I understand that everyone is suffering, but there's no point in just staying down.

MsgJp:
ほら、気持ちの持ち方ってところも
絶対あるはずだから――
せっかく生きてるんだ
前を向くふりだけでもしないと
MsgEn:
See, there should be a way to change your perspective – you're still alive after all. 
You have to at least pretend to look forward.

MsgJp:
こうして命があること自体を喜ばないと――
そう、昨日してた心配は杞憂だったってね
MsgEn: To not rejoice in the very fact that we have life... Yes, it turns out that the worry I had yesterday was needless.

MsgJp:
何か欲しいものがあるの？
残念だけど、あんまり品ぞろえは
よくないわよ
MsgEn: Is there something you want? Unfortunately, our selection isn't very good.

MsgJp:
この状況でアレコレ欲しがる人も
居ないとは思うけど
本当に、最低限の物資しか無くてね
MsgEn: I don't think there are people who would want this and that in this situation, but really, we only have the bare minimum supplies.

MsgJp:
精一杯かき集めてきてコレなのよ
いつまで持つか――
でも、ある物でどうにかするしかないわよね
MsgEn:
I have gathered everything I could, but this is all we have.
I wonder how long it will last...
But we have no choice but to make do with what we have.

MsgJp:
あなたも、あんまり泣き言は言わないようにして
みんな我慢してるんだから
MsgEn:
Please try not to complain too much.
Everyone is being patient, you know.

MsgJp:
なんだよ
――用も無いのにこっち見るのやめろよ
MsgEn:
What's the matter?
――Stop looking over here for no reason.

MsgJp:
こんなところに潜んで
一体何になるっていうんだ――
ここでボサッとしてる奴らの気が知れねぇ
MsgEn:
What's the point of lurking around in a place like this? 
I can't understand the mindset of these guys loafing around here.

MsgJp:
こうしてる間にもどこかの村が
オークに襲われてるんだぜ
――やりきれねぇよ
MsgEn: While we're here, some village somewhere is being attacked by Orcs. I can't bear it anymore.

MsgJp:
オレはこんなところにいたくないね
逃げるか戦うか、さっさと決めちまいたい
――ハァ
MsgEn:
I don't want to be in a place like this.
I want to make a decision and either run away or fight, quickly.
- Haah.

MsgJp:
なんだ、あんた？
わざわざ話しかけるような用でもあるのか？
MsgEn:
What is it, you?
Do you have a reason to talk to me?

MsgJp:
ここまでめちゃくちゃになったら
もう何も信じられねぇ
信じたヤツから死んでくんだからよ
MsgEn:
Once it becomes completely chaotic, I can't believe in anything anymore.
Because death awaits those whom I believed in.

MsgJp:
あんたも命が惜しけりゃ慎重にいくことだ
俺からはそれくらいしか言うことは無いな
MsgEn:
If you value your life, you should proceed with caution.
That's all I have to say.

MsgJp:
俺なんか、もう命くらいしか
無くして惜しいものも無いからよ
――こればっかりはな
MsgEn: As for me, I don't really have anything left to lose except my life – it's all I've got left.

MsgJp:
俺に何度も話しかけてどうするつもりだ？
懐に入り込んで、なけなしの金でも
毟り取るつもりか？
MsgEn:
What's the point of talking to me repeatedly? 
Do you plan to get into my pocket and take even the last bit of money I have?

MsgJp:
ふん、まぁ――
ここなら――
MsgEn:
Hmph, well...
If it's here...

MsgJp:
――もう、いつこの人生が終わるかって
これ以上何にも奪われたくないって
そんなことしか考えてなかったんだが
MsgEn: I've been thinking only about when this life will end, and how I don't want anything else to be taken away from me.

MsgJp:
こうして取り戻せたものもあるし
もう少し、生きる努力をしてみても
いいのかもな
MsgEn:
There are things that can be regained like this, so it might be worth trying a little harder to live.
Yes.

MsgJp:
いや、でも俺は信じねえぞ
期待すると後が辛い
何が起こっても
「覚悟はできてた」って思いてぇんだ
MsgEn:
No, but I don't believe in it.
Expectations only lead to bitterness in the end.
No matter what happens, I want to think, "I was prepared for this."

MsgJp:
昔のこと思い出しても
良いことねぇな
MsgEn: Even when I remember the things from the past, there's nothing good about it.

MsgJp:
――あ、はい
何でしょう
MsgEn:
- Ah, yes.
What is it?

MsgJp: 少し、疲れて――
MsgEn: A little tired...

MsgJp: 家族のことを想うと――
MsgEn: When I think about my family...

MsgJp: どうしようも、なかったんです――
MsgEn: There was nothing I could do...

MsgJp:
――ぐすっ
ああ、すみません
MsgEn:
- Sniff
Oh, I'm sorry.

MsgJp: 家族のことが頭をよぎって――
MsgEn: Thoughts of my family crossed my mind...

MsgJp:
――私も解放軍の一員なのですから
皆さんのために、何かするべきでしょうね
MsgEn: ――Since I'm also a member of the Liberation Army, I should do something for everyone's sake.

MsgJp:
はぁ――
もう少しだけ、一人でいても良いでしょうか
MsgEn:
Sigh――
Is it alright if I stay alone for a little longer?

MsgJp:
ごめんなさい
話をするのが億劫で――
MsgEn:
I'm sorry.
It's too much of a hassle to talk...

MsgJp:
あ――
な、なんでしょう――
MsgEn:
Ah...
W-what is it...

MsgJp:
ここに匿ってもらえて、心底感謝しとります
もう、帰る家も無くなったものですから――
MsgEn:
I am deeply grateful for being able to hide here.
I no longer have a home to return to...

MsgJp:
家も、家畜も、今頃全部灰になっているでしょう
――大変な思いをして手に入れてきた財産でした
MsgEn:
The house, the livestock, they must all be turned to ashes by now.
It was a fortune that we obtained after going through great hardships.

MsgJp:
何よりも気がかりなのは
離ればなれになった妻のことでして――
ここに一緒にいられたら、それだけで
どんなに気が楽だったか
MsgEn: The most worrisome thing is the separation from my wife – it would have been so much more reassuring if we could have been together here.

MsgJp: ――何か？
MsgEn: —What is it?

MsgJp:
ここにもきっとすぐにオークたちが来る――
こんな貧弱な拠点、一たまりも無いわ
MsgEn: The orcs will surely come here soon... This weak base is worth nothing.

MsgJp:
オークが攻めてきたら
こんなテントで寝起きしてる私たちなんて
真っ先に殺されるでしょうね
せめて小屋に入れてもらえないかしら――
MsgEn:
If the Orcs were to attack, we, who are sleeping in such a tent, would surely be killed first, wouldn't we?
I wonder if they could at least let us into a cabin...

MsgJp:
もっとしっかりした拠点、どこかに無いかしら
良いところがあれば、そっちに移りたい――
MsgEn:
I wonder if there's a more solid base somewhere.
If there's a good place, I'd like to move there...

MsgJp: よう、元気してる？
MsgEn: Hey, are you doing well?

MsgJp:
休んでいくなら<VAL PRICE_INN>だ
見ての通り、ここって色んな店があるから
ちょっと騒がしいけど――耳栓も貸し出すからさ
それでもいいかい？
MsgEn:
If you want to rest, it's <VAL PRICE_INN>. 
As you can see, there are various shops here, so it might get noisy, but we can provide earplugs if you'd like.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
ああ、休みたいのか
えーっと、ベッドは空いてるな――
サービスしとくぜ、好きに使ってってくれ
MsgEn:
Ah, do you want to take a break?
Um, the bed is available... 
I'll provide the service, so use it however you like.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》かい？
よしきた、気合入れて治療するよ
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>だけど、いいかな
MsgEn:
"Treat Weakness," huh? 
Alright, I'll put my fighting spirit into the treatment. 
It's <VAL PRICE_WEAK>, but is that okay?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
んー、弱化してないけどな
ほら、気持ちの問題じゃないか？
ちょっとそこら辺で好みの子に
声かけてこれば気も晴れるよ、きっと
MsgEn:
Well, you haven't weakened, you know. It's all about the state of mind, isn't it? 
Just try talking to someone you like around here, and your spirits will lift for sure.

MsgJp:
どっかに可愛い子いたら教えてくれよ
こんな時だからこそ、楽しみが必要さ！
MsgEn:
If you find a cute girl somewhere, let me know.
Especially at times like this, we need something to look forward to!

MsgJp:
ちょっと微笑んでくれる可愛い子が
いるってだけで毎日頑張れるってもんだろ？　
ホント、それだけでいいんだよな～
MsgEn:
Just having a cute girl who smiles at me makes me able to do my best every day.
Really, that's all I need~

MsgJp:
まぁ、どんなに可愛い子がいても
俺のフィアンセには適わないだろうけど――
MsgEn: Well, no matter how cute of a girl, she wouldn't be suitable as my fiancee--

MsgJp:
嫌がってたけど、村に残してきたんだよな
だって、こんなとこに連れてくるのも危ないだろ
あいつからは少しの危険だって
遠ざけておきたかったんだ
MsgEn:
I know they didn't want to, but they left me behind in the village.
Because it's dangerous to bring me to a place like this, right?
I just wanted to keep a little distance from them, even if it meant a small danger.

MsgJp:
いらっしゃいませ
幅広く取り揃えてますよ
MsgEn:
Welcome.
We have a wide variety of items.

MsgJp:
いや、恐ろしいことになりましたね――
ティネス砦を奪還できたのは嬉しいことですが
ここもまたいつ魔軍に攻め込まれるか
MsgEn:
No, it's become quite terrifying――
While it's good that we were able to retake Fort Thines,
we never know when the Demon Army will attack here again.

MsgJp:
まぁ、私には昔からやってる
商売くらいしかできませんから
やれることをやるだけです
MsgEn:
Well, since I've been doing business for as long as I can remember, I can't do anything else but that.
I'll just do what I can.

MsgJp:
先祖代々、商いをやってきとります
こうしてやれることをやることが
今私らに一番大切なことじゃないですかね
MsgEn:
Throughout generations, we have been engaged in business.
Isn't it the most important thing for us now to do what we can do?

MsgJp:
あら、覚者様
新しい武具がご入用でしょうか
MsgEn:
Oh, Lord Arisen.
Do you need new equipment?

MsgJp:
ティネス砦を取り戻せたのも
覚者様のお力あってのことと聞いております
ありがとうございます
MsgEn: We've heard that Fort Thines was retaken, thanks to the power of the Arisen. Thank you.

MsgJp:
今まで良いニュースなんて一つもありませんでした
覚者様が来てくださってから、何だか
希望が見えてきたような気がします
MsgEn:
Until now, there hasn't been a single piece of good news. 
But ever since the Arisen arrived, it feels like we've glimpsed some hope.

MsgJp:
色々取り揃えております
どうぞ見ていってくださいね
MsgEn: We have a variety of items available. Please take a look.

MsgJp:
あっ、ハイ！
同行者をお探しでしょうか、覚者様
MsgEn: Ah, yes! Are you looking for a companion, Lord Arisen?

MsgJp: 同行者をお探しでしたら、僕がお役に立てますよ！
MsgEn: If you're looking for a companion, I can be of help!

MsgJp:
足の速さにはちょっと自信があるんです
人探しなんかも得意なんですよ
MsgEn: I have a little confidence in my speed, you know. I'm also good at searching for people.

MsgJp:
覚者様に話しかけていただけるなんて
この任務について良かったです！
MsgEn: Arisen, please talk to me about the matter of "Blood Orbs" whenever you need to exchange them.

MsgJp:
あ、覚者様じゃないですか
何のご用でしょうか
MsgEn: Oh, it's the Arisen, isn't it? How may I assist you?

MsgJp:
――ハァ
い、いえ、何でもありません！
申し訳ございません
MsgEn:
- *Sigh*
N-No, it's nothing! I apologize.

MsgJp:
ちょっと――最近眠れなくて
ハッ、も、申し訳ございません
覚者様にお話するようなことではありませんでした
MsgEn:
Just a moment... I've been having trouble sleeping lately. 
Uh, I'm sorry, that's not something to discuss with someone like you, Arisen.

MsgJp:
い、今までずっと先輩と一緒だったんですが
任地が分かれてしまいまして――
オレ一人では、何とも――
MsgEn:
Well, I've always been with my senior until now, but our assignments were separated. 
I'm not sure if I can manage by myself.

MsgJp: ああ、覚者さまじゃないか！
MsgEn: Oh, it's the Arisen!

MsgJp:
ティネス砦は覚者さまのお陰で
奪還できたようなところだからね！
また奪われないように、こうして見張ってるよ
MsgEn: Fort Thines was retaken thanks to your help, Arisen! We're here to prevent it from being taken again.

MsgJp:
リキャルドのヤツ、顔真っ青だろ
まぁ仕方ないよねぇ
戦に向いてないんだろうね、可哀想なもんだよ
MsgEn:
Ricardo looks pale, doesn't he? Well, it can't be helped. 
He's not cut out for battle, poor guy.

MsgJp:
もし敵が攻めてきたらさ、アタシがまず
ここで少しでも時間を稼いで――
その間にリキャルドに門を閉めるように
言ってあるんだ
MsgEn: If the enemy attacks, I'll try to buy some time here, and during that time, I've told Ricardo to close the gate.

MsgJp:
ああ、覚者さん
どうかしたか？
MsgEn: Ah, Arisen, is there something you need?

MsgJp:
俺の調子？
まぁまぁだな
絶好調でも、特に悪いわけでもない
見たところ覚者さんもそうだろ
MsgEn:
How am I doing?
I'm doing okay.
I'm not in perfect condition, but I'm not particularly bad either.
It seems like you're the same, Arisen.

MsgJp:
色々あったし、これからもあるだろうけど
悩んだところで仕方ないからな――
MsgEn: There have been various things, and there will be more in the future, but there's no use in worrying about it ――

MsgJp:
覚者さんも色々あると思うけど
あんまり思い悩むより
割り切っていった方がいいぜ
MsgEn:
Arisen, I think there are various things that even those who have awakened go through. 
Instead of worrying too much, it's better to accept and move on.

MsgJp:
ああ、覚者さまですか
いえ、避難してきた人たちが可哀想でね――
私に何かできれば良いのですが
MsgEn:
Ah, are you an Arisen, my Lord?
No, it's just that the people who have taken refuge here are so pitiful...
If there's anything I can do to help, please let me know.

MsgJp:
家を焼け出され、財産を全て失い
家族すら亡くしてここに駆け込んでくる人が
いるんですよ――気の毒としか言いようがない
MsgEn: They have lost their homes, all their possessions, and even their families, and yet they come running here... There's no other way to describe it but unfortunate.

MsgJp:
どうにか避難してきた人たちの力に
なりたいんですが、この砦はまだまだ物資も
人手も不足していますからな
ままならないものです
MsgEn:
I want to be of help to the people who managed to take shelter here, but this fort is still lacking in supplies and manpower.
It's not in a good state.

MsgJp:
広場にいるミカエラなど
あの幼さで親も兄弟も亡くしているのですよ
家族の話をすると、目に涙をいっぱい溜めて――
MsgEn:
People like Michaela in the plaza, she lost her parents and siblings at such a young age.
When she talks about her family, tears fill her eyes...

MsgJp:
どうかなさいましたか、覚者様
こちらは特に問題ありませんが――
MsgEn: What's wrong, Lord? We don't have any particular problems here...

MsgJp:
魔軍に占領されていた間に
この砦もかなり傷んでしまいました
まだ完全に復旧していないところも
あるようですね
MsgEn:
While occupied by the Demon Army, this fortress has also sustained considerable damage.
There are still parts that have not been completely restored it seems.

MsgJp:
私も工事を手伝っていますが
この砦が完全にかつての姿に戻るまでは
時間がかかるでしょう――
MsgEn: I'm also assisting with the construction, but it will take time for this fortress to fully return to its former glory.

MsgJp:
仮組の足場には手すりがありません
足を滑らせないよう気を付けてくださいね
いくら覚者様でも、この高さですから
MsgEn:
Be careful as there are no handrails on the temporary scaffolding. 
It's a long way down, even for the Arisen.

MsgJp:
はいはい、何でしょうか
自分でお役に立てることならお手伝いします
MsgEn: Alright, alright, what can I help you with? If there's anything I can assist with, I'll be happy to.

MsgJp:
自分は家も家具も、丸ごと
全部焼かれちまいましたから
また一つ一つ揃えるところからですよ
MsgEn: I lost everything in the fire – my house, furniture, everything. I'll have to start gathering things one by one.

MsgJp:
何の取り柄もないんでね、こうやって
兵士の皆さんの雑用でもやって
ちょっとずつ生きてく道を探っとかないとね
MsgEn: I don't have any particular talents, so I'm helping out with various odd jobs for the soldiers, slowly finding a way to live.

MsgJp:
まだまだ故郷に帰れる状況じゃありませんけど
いつかまた、生まれ育った村に家を建てたいんです
それだけが自分の夢ですよ、ははは
MsgEn:
It's still not a situation where I can return to my hometown.
But someday, I want to build a house in the village where I was born and raised.
That's the only dream I have, hahaha.

MsgJp:
こんにちは、覚者さま
えっと、ミカエラです
MsgEn:
Hello, Lord Arisen.
Um, I'm Michaela.

MsgJp:
あのお歌を教えてくれたのが
王子さまだったなんて、知らなかったの
MsgEn: I didn't know that the prince was the one who taught me that song.

MsgJp:
王子さまはとっても優しかったよ
わたしが泣いてたから
ずっとそばにいてくれた
MsgEn:
The prince was very kind.
He stayed by my side the whole time I was crying.

MsgJp:
ほんとはね、今も、ひとりでさみしい――
でも、助けてもらったんだから
わたしも頑張ります
MsgEn: Honestly, I still feel lonely now – but since you've helped me, I'll do my best.

MsgJp:
あー、見つかっちゃったか
隠れてるつもりだったんだけどなぁ
MsgEn: Ah, it seems I've been found out. I thought I was hiding well.

MsgJp:
砦に入れてもらえたのはいいんだけど
人手が足りないからってさ
鎧着せられそうになってびっくりしたよ
MsgEn: I'm glad they let me into the fortress, but I was surprised when they tried to put armor on me because they're short-staffed.

MsgJp:
僕、大きい音がダメになっちゃってさ
血の臭いとかも――
絶対、気が遠くなってくるんだ
弱虫だろ
MsgEn:
I can't handle loud noises, you know.
Even the smell of blood...
It makes me feel dizzy.
I'm such a coward.

MsgJp:
覚者さんはいいなぁ
血が出ても、ちょっとくらいなら死なないんだろ
僕の姉さんはあっという間に顔が
真っ白になっちゃってさ――
MsgEn:
Arisen are amazing, aren't they?
Even if they bleed, they probably won't die from just a little.
My older sister's face turned completely pale in an instant...

MsgJp:
あら、覚者様！
砦奪還の英雄じゃないですか
MsgEn:
Oh, Lord Arisen!
You're the hero who recaptured the fortress, aren't you?

MsgJp:
お聞きになった？
あそこにいるミカエラっていう女の子
あの子の歌から、ネド王子のご存命が
わかったそうですわよ
MsgEn: Did you hear about it? Thanks to that girl Michaela over there, we learned that Prince Nedo's alive from her song.

MsgJp:
ここにいる武装してる人たちってね
元々軍属だった兵士さんもいれば
兵士も民間人も寄せ集めで武装したっていう
解放軍の戦士さんもいるらしいですよ
MsgEn:
The armed individuals here, you see, include not only former military personnel, but also a mix of soldiers and civilians who armed themselves.
There are even warriors from the Liberation Army, it seems.

MsgJp:
私、ここに寄せてもらう前は
近くの洞窟の入り口で雨風を
しのいでたんです――
薄気味悪くて堪らなかったわね――
MsgEn:
Before I came here, I was taking shelter at the entrance of a nearby cave to escape from the rain and wind ――
It was creepy and unbearable――

MsgJp:
あら、覚者さま
こんなところにまで、どうされました？
MsgEn: Oh, Lord Arisen. What brings you to this place?

MsgJp:
オークに捕らわれた人たちを
解放してあげることができて良かった――
危ないところでしたから
MsgEn: I'm glad I could free the people captured by the orcs – it was a dangerous situation.

MsgJp:
捕らわれていた人たちは
まだ深く傷ついていて――
無理もないことです
MsgEn: The people who were captured are still deeply wounded, and it's completely understandable.

MsgJp:
兵士である私がここに残ることで
みなさん、少しは気持ちが安らぐようですよ
MsgEn: By remaining here as a soldier, I hope it can bring some peace of mind to all of you.

MsgJp:
ああ、覚者様
様子を見に来てくださったのですか？
MsgEn: Oh, Arisen, have you come to check on the situation?

MsgJp:
この村が解放されたのも
覚者様のお陰と聞いております
ありがとうございます
MsgEn:
I have heard that this village was liberated thanks to the Arisen. 
Thank you.

MsgJp:
まだ気疲れが取れませんでな
いえ、覚者様に気にしていただくようなことでは――
MsgEn: I still can't shake off my fatigue. No, it's not something for the Arisen to worry about...

MsgJp:
もう、捕らわれていた時は
色々と覚悟をしていましたので――
まだ緊張が抜けないと言いますか、ね――
MsgEn: Even when I was captured, I was prepared for various things. I can't say the tension has completely eased.

MsgJp: やぁ、覚者様じゃないですか
MsgEn: Oh, if it isn't the Arisen!

MsgJp:
こうして暮らしていけるのも
この村を解放してくださったお陰ですよ
MsgEn: We are able to live like this thanks to the liberation of this village.

MsgJp:
これから、ですか？
――いえ、以前と同じように暮らしていきます
MsgEn:
From now on?
――No, we will continue to live as we did before.

MsgJp:
囚われている間、ずっと
前みたいに暮らしたいって思ってたんです
地味な生活、大いに結構ですよ
MsgEn: While I was imprisoned, I kept thinking I wanted to live like I used to. A simple life is more than fine.

MsgJp:
働いて、食べて、寝る
これ以外のことは今のところ
何も望んじゃいません
MsgEn: Work, eat, sleep – I don't want anything else for now.

MsgJp:
ふぅ――
あ、ハイハイ！　何がご入用でしょう？
MsgEn: Phew, uh, yes, what can I assist you with?

MsgJp:
そりゃ、辛いことも疲れも溜まってますけどね
働かないことには、ねぇ
MsgEn: Well, even with the hardships and exhaustion, we can't just sit around doing nothing, can we?

MsgJp:
うちの店、どうです？
よそのお店ってもっと品揃えが
良かったりするのかしら――
MsgEn: How do you like our shop? I wonder if other shops have better selections.

MsgJp:
セイディは――
セイディは、私の姪なんです
MsgEn:
Sadie is...
Sadie is my niece.

MsgJp: だから、私が替わりに育ててやれたらって――
MsgEn: That's why I wanted to take care of her instead...

MsgJp: 覚者さま、こんにちは
MsgEn: Lord Arisen, hello.

MsgJp: オークは臭いからキライ
MsgEn: I hate Orcs because they smell.

MsgJp:
檻の中に入れられたの、すごく嫌だった
覚者さまが助けてくれたんだよね
MsgEn:
I really hated being put in a cage.
Lord Arisen, thank you for saving me.

MsgJp:
ねぇ、覚者さま
ママを知らない？
わたし、ママと違うところに閉じ込められてたの
MsgEn:
Hey, Arisen. Do you know where my mom is? 
I was kept somewhere different from her.

MsgJp: はい、何でしょう
MsgEn: Yes, what is it?

MsgJp:
そうですね、一応は私が
ここの守備責任者ということになります
MsgEn: Well, I suppose for now, I will be in charge of the defense here.

MsgJp:
――ああ、エディの言うことは
気になさらないでください
MsgEn: - Please don't worry about what Eddie says, okay?

MsgJp:
どこも物資、人手共に不足しています
ギリギリですが、あるもので
どうにかするしかないでしょう――
MsgEn:
Supplies and manpower are scarce everywhere. 
We're barely managing, but we have no choice but to make do with what we have until...

MsgJp:
おおっ、覚者様
何かご用でしょうか！
MsgEn:
Oh, Arisen!
What can I do for you?

MsgJp:
早く手柄を立てて、カーティス隊長の
自慢の部下になりたいんですよ
MsgEn: I want to quickly accomplish great feats and become Captain Curtis' proudest subordinate.

MsgJp:
いえね、俺ってこう見えて
元は木こりやってたんですよ
でも解放軍に入って、これは運命かも知れないって
MsgEn: Actually, I used to be a lumberjack. But now I'm in the Liberation Army, so this might be fate.

MsgJp:
もう何でもいいから
とにかく手柄立てられないかな――
MsgEn: I don't care about anything anymore, so could I at least achieve some kind of accomplishment...

MsgJp:
あー、はいはい
何が必要ですかね
MsgEn:
Ah, yes, yes.
What do you need?

MsgJp:
ああ、道具類の手入れはこまめにしてますよ
きっちり使えますんで、安心して
買ってってください
MsgEn: Ah, I regularly maintain and take care of my tools, so you can rest assured. Please go ahead and purchase them.

MsgJp:
はいはい、なんですかね
――俺からは特に用は無いんですけど
MsgEn:
Yes, yes, what is it?
――I don't particularly have any business with you.

MsgJp:
火種は大量に買っといた方がいいですよ
何と言っても、そんなにかさばりませんから
そんでもって無いと大変なことになるでしょう
MsgEn: It's a good idea to stock up on tinder. After all, it doesn't take up much space, and it can be a lifesaver.

MsgJp:
洞窟の奥で火種が切れる――
なんて状況、ゾッとしますからね
MsgEn:
The fire dies out deep in the cave -
Such a situation gives me the chills, you know.

MsgJp: ――何か用かな
MsgEn: Do you have any business with me?

MsgJp:
特に怪我はなさそうだね
よかった
MsgEn: It doesn't seem like there are any injuries in particular. That's a relief.

MsgJp:
ここでの任務が終われば
また別の任地に送られるだけだ
ま、それが仕事だから
MsgEn: Since you're here, how about taking a little break too, Arisen? You need a good night's sleep to stay sharp for when it really matters.

MsgJp: 覚者ってのも大変そうだな
MsgEn: Being an Arisen seems like a tough job, doesn't it?

MsgJp:
イェルハルド様は多忙だ
ロスギルの村のことなら
まずは俺を通してもらおうか
MsgEn: Lord Gerhard is busy. If it's about Rothgill village, it's better to go through me.

MsgJp:
俺が誰かって？
イェルハルド様の筆頭補佐官といえば俺だ
――まぁ、貴方はこの国の者でもない
多少の無礼も大目に見よう
MsgEn:
Who am I, you ask? I'm the chief assistant to Lord Gerhard. 
Well, since you're not from this country, I'll overlook a little rudeness.

MsgJp:
イェルハルド様はお忙しい
伝言なら俺がことづかろう
MsgEn: Lord Gerhard is quite busy. If it's a message, I can take care of it.

MsgJp:
怪しげであっても客人だ
イェルハルド様のためにも
貴方をもてなすよう皆に言っておいた
MsgEn:
Even if it's suspicious, you're a guest. 
I've told everyone to treat you well for Lord Gerhard's sake.

MsgJp:
や、調子どうだい？
戦技のことなら相談に乗るよ
MsgEn: Hey, how are you doing? If you have any questions about battle techniques, I'm here to help.

MsgJp:
いやー、いいねぇ
自分の望んだように戦えるっての
羨ましいよ
MsgEn:
Oh, I see. That's nice.
Being able to fight the way you want, I'm envious.

MsgJp:
アタシ？
アタシは今、療養中ってやつさ
体が良くなれば、また村の外に行くつもりだよ
MsgEn: Me? I'm currently in recovery. Once my body gets better, I plan to go outside the village again.

MsgJp:
覚者ってのは色んな技を覚えてるもんだね
戦技補佐のしがいがあるよ
MsgEn: Arisen are skilled in various techniques, huh? There's satisfaction in supporting their martial arts.

MsgJp:
ようこそおいでくださいました
さぁ、ゆっくり休んでいってくださいね
MsgEn: Welcome, please come in and rest. Take your time to relax.

MsgJp:
ご宿泊は<VAL PRICE_INN>です
ロスギル名物、翡翠湖で採れた魚を使った
お粥もサービスしますよ！
きっと身も心も癒されるはずです
MsgEn:
Your accommodation is <VAL PRICE_INN>. 
We'll also serve you some rice porridge made with fish from the famous Emerald Lake in Rothgill. 
It should surely heal your body and soul.

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
ええ、どうぞこのロスギルで
長旅の疲れを癒してください
干し魚を使ったお粥、この辺りの名物なんです
こちらも、よかったら食べていってくださいね！
MsgEn:
Well, feel free to rest in Rothgill. 
We have a local specialty, fish porridge made from dried fish. 
It's a famous dish around here. You're welcome to try it if you'd like!

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》ですね！
はい、もちろん承っていますとも
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>ですが、よろしいですか？
MsgEn:
It's "Treat Weakness", right?
Yes, of course, I can do that.
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>, is that okay?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
あら、弱化していらっしゃいませんよ？
弱化していないものを治療しろとは――
謎かけみたいですね、フフフ
MsgEn:
Oh, you're not weakened, are you? 
To treat something that isn't weakened... 
It's like a riddle, isn't it? Hehehe.

MsgJp:
ロスギルの見どころ、ですか？
それはもちろん、翡翠湖です！
美しい滝もご覧いただけますよ
MsgEn: What are the highlights of Rothgill? Of course, it's Emerald Lake! You can also see beautiful waterfalls.

MsgJp:
翡翠湖で採れる魚は
ロスギルの食生活を支えてくれています
煮てよし、焼いてよし、干してよし、なんです
MsgEn:
The fish caught in Emerald Lake supports Rothgill's diet.
It can be boiled, grilled, or dried, offering various culinary options.

MsgJp:
こうしてお仕事をし始めたのも
最近のことなんです
今はどこも大変ですからね
MsgEn: I only began working like this recently. Things are tough everywhere right now.

MsgJp:
いらっしゃいませ、覚者様
今日は何をお探しで？
MsgEn:
Welcome, Lord Arisen.
What are you looking for today?

MsgJp:
いや、戦のせいで縮小してしまいましたが
元はもっと大きな店を出してたんですよ
村の外に何店舗も店がありましてね
MsgEn:
No, it's because of the war that it has shrunk, but we used to have a much bigger shop, you know. 
Outside the village, there were several other stores.

MsgJp:
イェルハルド様はご立派な方ですよ
あの方がいらっしゃらなかったら
この村も今頃オークの拠点になってるところです
MsgEn:
Lord Gerhard is a noble person. 
If he wasn't here, this village would have become an Orc stronghold by now.

MsgJp:
もしこのロスギルが危ない状態になっても――
私はここを離れないって決めてるんです
代々ここで商売してますんで
MsgEn: Even if Rothgill were in a dangerous state, I have made the decision not to leave this place. My family has been running a business here for generations.

MsgJp: 覚者様、旅の同行者をお探しでしょうか？
MsgEn: Arisen, are you looking for a travel companion?

MsgJp:
お知り合いへのご連絡、それから
ポーンの呼び出しなんかも
お手伝いいたしますよ
MsgEn: I can help you with contacting acquaintances and even calling your Pawn.

MsgJp:
こうしていられるのも、イェルハルド様が
しっかりロスギルを治めてくださるお陰ですな
MsgEn: It is thanks to Lord Gerhard's firm rule over Rothgill that we are able to stay like this.

MsgJp:
火にあたりながら
細々したものを作るのが好きでして――
何、つまらないものばかりなんですがね
MsgEn: I enjoy making small things by the fire – nothing special, though.

MsgJp:
覚者さま、《ブラッドオーブ》の交換であれば
わたしがご相談にのりましょう
MsgEn: Arisen, if it's for exchanging "Blood Orbs," I'll be the one to help you.

MsgJp:
こうしてお仕事をしていれば
少しは気もまぎれるというものです
MsgEn: In this central area of the swamp, there are harmful monsters gathering.

MsgJp:
エルセンさんは戦が始まる前から、この辺りで
手広く商いをしてらした方なんですよ
こうしてわたしにも、場所を貸してくださっています
MsgEn:
Elsen here has been involved in various businesses around here even before the war started. 
And they've also lent me this place.

MsgJp:
覚者であれば、きっと色々と
達観していらっしゃるのでしょうね
わたしなどはあれこれ悩みが多くて――
MsgEn:
If you are an Arisen, you must surely have a more enlightened perspective on things. 
I, on the other hand, have many worries...

MsgJp:
おっ、覚者さんじゃないですか
何かご用で？
MsgEn: Oh, it's the Arisen, isn't it? Do you have some business with me?

MsgJp:
ロスギルはいいですね
この戦乱の最中にあって
食べる物にも住む場所にも困っていない
イェルハルド殿の見事な手腕によるものでしょう
MsgEn:
Rothgill is nice. 
Even in the midst of this chaos, they have no problems with food and shelter. 
Thanks to Lord Gerhard's excellent management.

MsgJp:
そういえば、ロスギル名物の
魚と貝の粥はもう召し上がりましたか？
宿屋で出されるアレです
MsgEn:
By the way, have you tried Rothgill's famous fish and shellfish porridge?
It's served at the inn.

MsgJp:
他でも食べられますが
やはりロスギルの魚を使っているだけあって
一味違いますよ！
MsgEn: You can eat this elsewhere, but using Rothgill's fish does make a difference!

MsgJp:
村から村へ手紙を届ける仕事をしてたんです
こんな状況ですから、みな遠くに住む親せきや
友人を心配して手紙を書くんです
MsgEn:
I used to work delivering letters from village to village. 
With this situation, everyone worries about their relatives and friends who live far away and writes letters to them.

MsgJp:
最近は――宛先として書かれている村が
無くなってることも多くなって――
少し疲れましてね
MsgEn: Recently, many of the villages listed as destinations are disappearing – it's tiring.

MsgJp:
私に何か用があるなんて
珍しいね？
MsgEn: Do you have business with me? That's unusual.

MsgJp:
ロスギルの人たちは外の状況を
分かっているのかしら？
あまりにものんびりしすぎてない？
MsgEn: Do the people in Rothgill really understand the conditions outside? Aren't they too relaxed?

MsgJp:
今はまだ修行中の身だけど
近いうちに、必ず戦士として身を立ててみせるわ
MsgEn: Right now, I'm still in the midst of training, but soon I will definitely prove myself as a Soldier.

MsgJp:
いてもたってもいられないって
こういう気持ちのことを言うのね――
MsgEn: I just couldn't sit around and do nothing. This is what I mean by these feelings.

MsgJp:
あれ？　この村の人じゃない人だ
こんにちは
MsgEn: Huh? You're not from this village. Hello.

MsgJp:
うんうん、知ってるよ
戦争が始まったから、村の外に
出ちゃいけないんだよね
MsgEn: Yeah, I know. We can't leave the village because of the war.

MsgJp:
外は怖いことがいっぱいあるけど
ロスギルは大丈夫なんでしょ？
MsgEn: There are many scary things outside, but is Rothgill safe?

MsgJp:
あなたも外が怖いなら
ずっとロスギルにいてもいいよ！
MsgEn: If you're also afraid of the outside, you're welcome to stay in Rothgill!

MsgJp: ――なんだね
MsgEn: --What is it?

MsgJp:
――腹でも減ったのか？
そこにある魚をつまんでいってもいいぞ
焼いただけだが、味は保障する
MsgEn: Are you hungry? You can have some of the fish over there. They're just roasted, but the taste is guaranteed.

MsgJp:
戦が始まる前からこうして釣りをしている
うちの親父も、そのまた親父も釣りをして
暮らしてたんだ
MsgEn: I've been fishing like this even before the war began. My father and his father also lived by fishing.

MsgJp:
ロスギルの村人がまだ安定しているのは
魚が獲れさえすれば、少なくとも
食べ物には困らないからだ
――だからこうして釣りをしている
MsgEn:
The villagers in Rothgill are still stable because as long as they can catch fish, they won't have any shortage of food. 
That's why they are fishing like this.

MsgJp:
あっ、はい
作業をしながらですみません――
MsgEn: Ah, yes. I apologize for working while speaking.

MsgJp:
こうやって魚を干すと
保存がきいて持ち運びも楽だし
旨みが増すんです
MsgEn: Drying fish like this preserves them and makes them easy to carry, and also enhances their flavor.

MsgJp: はぁ、ぼくもずっと釣りをしてたいな――
MsgEn: Sigh, I wish I could fish all day...

MsgJp:
両親はぼくに
立派な騎士になってほしいそうなんです
――でも、ぼくは魚釣りが好きだな
MsgEn: My parents want me to become a splendid knight, but I really love fishing.

MsgJp: ん？　どうかした？
MsgEn: Hmmm, what's wrong?

MsgJp:
ベルタママがいない間
一応ココはあたしがまとめてるからさ
何かあったら聞きにきな
MsgEn: While Lady Bertha is away, I'll be in charge here for now. If you have any problems, feel free to come and ask.

MsgJp:
あたしらなんかは
ママから生まれたわけじゃないけどさ
そういうことじゃないだろ、家族の絆って
MsgEn: We may not have been born from the same mother, but that's not what matters when it comes to family bonds.

MsgJp:
ちょっと荒っぽいヤツもいるかもしれないけど
皆気はいいヤツらだよ
他の拠点とそう変わらないって！
MsgEn: There might be a few rough ones here, but they're all good people. Not that different from other bases!

MsgJp:
俺たちとあんたらに未来があるなら
仲良く過ごすか敵対しあうか――
MsgEn: If there's a future for us and you, will we spend it getting along or fighting each other?

MsgJp: お頭次第だろうね
MsgEn: It depends on the leader.

MsgJp:
そっちには王子、こっちにはお頭が戻って
絶望的な雰囲気が少し変わった気がするよ
MsgEn:
On one side, we have the prince, and on the other side, the leader has returned. 
The despairing atmosphere feels like it has changed a little.

MsgJp:
お頭はすっかり王子の取り巻きだ
盗賊稼業はどうなるのかね
MsgEn: The chief's already surrounded by Prince Nedo's entourage. What's going to happen to our thieving business?

MsgJp:
何だ、じっと見て
用でもあんのか？
MsgEn:
What, are you just staring at me?
Do you need something?

MsgJp:
盗賊っていっても
俺らは殺して奪うようなことはしてねぇよ
子供をさらったりもしてねぇ
MsgEn: We may be thieves, but we don't kill or rob people. We don't kidnap children either.

MsgJp:
覚者ってのは正義の味方か？
だったら、俺とは気は合わないかもな
MsgEn: Are Arisen always champions of justice? If that's the case, we might not get along.

MsgJp:
竜のことはよく知らねぇんだ
王家の人間とその取り巻きが
なんかそれっぽくやってんだろ？
MsgEn: I don't know much about dragons. It seems like people from the royal family and their entourage are doing something related to them, though.

MsgJp:
この騒動はいい気晴らしになる
思う存分暴れてやるよ
MsgEn: This commotion will be a good diversion. Let's go wild to our heart's content.

MsgJp:
これからどうなるのかね
先のことが少し気になってきたな
MsgEn: I wonder what will happen from now on. I'm starting to get a little worried about the future.

MsgJp:
盗賊の頭脳ってのはキリッと冷めてるものさ
でも、熱く燃えるのも悪くはなかった
MsgEn:
The intellect of a bandit is sharp and cold.
But it wasn't bad to see it burn passionately too.

MsgJp: ああ、どうした
MsgEn: Ah, what's wrong?

MsgJp:
あんた、自分が覚者だってことに
誇りを持ってんだろ？
俺ら盗賊だって同じだ
MsgEn: You, do you take pride in being an Arisen? We bandits are the same.

MsgJp:
覚者ってのは思ってたより馴れ馴れしいもんだな
――いや、悪い意味じゃないんだ
MsgEn:
The Arisen are more familiar than I had imagined.
Well, I don't mean it in a bad way.

MsgJp:
そう話しかけられても
あんたのタメになるような話はできないぜ
MsgEn: Even if you talk to me, I can't tell you anything that would be of any benefit.

MsgJp:
疲れてるなら一眠りしていくか？
ここは静かだし、見た目よりは
寝心地も悪くないぜ
MsgEn: If you're tired, would you like to take a nap? It's quiet here, and the sleeping conditions aren't as bad as they may look.

MsgJp:
よし、一休みするなら<VAL PRICE_INN>だ
――これで金儲けしようってんじゃない
寝床を整える手間賃みたいなもんだよ
で、休んでいくのか？
MsgEn:
Alright, if you're going to take a break, it's <VAL PRICE_INN>. 
This is not about making money. 
It's more like a fee for preparing a comfortable place to sleep. So, are you going to rest?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
ああ、今なら好きに休んでいっていいぜ
あんたも覚者とはいえ、疲れ溜まってんだろ？
MsgEn:
Ah, if you feel like it, you can take a break however you want, you know? 
Even though you're an Arisen, you must be tired, right?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
《弱化の治療》か
いや、できるんだが俺たちのルールで
<VAL PRICE_WEAK>もらうことにしてるんだ
手持ちはあるのか？
MsgEn:
"Weakening Treatment," you say? 
Well, I can do it, but we've decided to charge <VAL PRICE_WEAK> for it according to our rules. 
Do you have enough on hand?

MsgJp: はい
MsgEn: OK

MsgJp: いいえ
MsgEn: Cancel

MsgJp:
ん？　弱化してるヤツってのは
もっと弱弱しい感じになるんだぜ
あんた、強いみたいだが演技はまだまだだな
MsgEn:
Huh? Weakened people tend to look weaker, you know? 
You seem strong, but your acting still needs work.

MsgJp:
寝床がもっとたくさんあれば
保護してる人たちもゆっくり休ませてやれるんだが
MsgEn: If we had more beds, we could let the people we're protecting rest more comfortably.

MsgJp:
まぁ、どう言いつくろっても盗賊だから
外でさ迷ってる人に声をかけても
逃げられることの方が多くて――
MsgEn:
Well, even though I may act as a bandit, I've often talked to people wandering outside. 
Most times, they just run away.

MsgJp:
俺たち盗賊団ほど自由な集まりは無いと思うぜ
色んなところへフラフラ行っちまうヤツが
結構多いから、外でも見かけるかもな
MsgEn:
I don't think there's a gathering as free as our thief gang. 
There are quite a few people who wander around in various places, so you might see them outside too.

MsgJp:
覚者さんか、いらっしゃい
さてと――ご用は何かな？
MsgEn: Welcome, Arisen. Now then, what can I do for you?

MsgJp:
おたく、今日もイカしてるぜ
数々の戦場を乗り越えてきた戦士の目をしてるよ
MsgEn: You, you're still rocking it today. You have the eyes of a warrior who's overcome many battlefields.

MsgJp:
ここにあるものは盗品じゃないから
安心して買い物してってくれ
――俺らはこういう日用品みたいな小物は
狙わない主義でね
MsgEn: Don't worry; the items here are not stolen. Feel free to shop with confidence. We have a policy not to target everyday items like this.

MsgJp:
並べてる商品は大体外の商人から
仕入れてきたもんだ
――ああ、後ろの酒瓶は俺のだけど
MsgEn: I've mostly purchased the products from outside merchants – oh, the bottles of alcohol in the back are mine, though.

MsgJp:
ああ、覚者さま
私に何かご用でも？
MsgEn:
Ah, Lord
Arisen, do you need something from me?

MsgJp:
何か盗賊の方たちのお手伝いをと思って――
散らばっていた道具なんかを片付けてみたんです
少しはきれいになったかと
MsgEn:
I thought I'd help out with something for the bandits. 
I tried to clean up some of the scattered tools. I wonder if it's a bit neater now.

MsgJp:
私にできることは無いかと聞いてみても
特に何も無いそうなんです
ただ休んでいるのも申し訳ないし
どうしましょうね――
MsgEn:
When I asked if there was anything I could do to help, they said there wasn't anything specific. 
I feel bad just resting, but what can we do?

MsgJp:
せっかく置いてもらっているのですから
盗賊の方たちのお役に立ちたいのですが――
MsgEn: We're here because you've left us this chance, and we'd like to be of service to the bandits.

MsgJp:
ごほっごほっ
ああ、すみません――
MsgEn:
Cough cough
Ah, I'm sorry--

MsgJp:
げほっごほっ
いや、ちょっとむせただけです
何でもないんですよ
MsgEn:
Cough cough
No, I just choked a bit.
It's nothing.

MsgJp:
はは、こうして人間らしく寝られるようになって
身も心も本当に助かりましたよ
木の根っこで丸まって休む日が続きましてね
限界だったんです
MsgEn:
Haha, being able to sleep like a human has really been a lifesaver. 
I've spent days curled up under tree roots to rest. 
I was at my limit.

MsgJp:
ごほん、げほっ
ちょ、ちょっと調子が悪いかなぁ
なんて、ハハハ――
MsgEn:
Ahem, cough
Um, umm, I'm feeling a bit off today
Uh, hahaha...

MsgJp:
あっ、覚者さんでしたか
ちょっとここのところ目がかすみまして
よくお顔が見えませんでした
MsgEn: Ah, so you're an Arisen, aren't you? I apologize, my vision has been a bit blurry lately, so I couldn't see your face clearly.

MsgJp:
いやぁ、盗賊の皆さんには
お世話になりました――
げほっ、ごほん
MsgEn: Well, I must say, I am grateful to all you bandits for your assistance-- *cough* *cough*

MsgJp:
こ、この通り――
ちょっと体調が悪そうに見えるらしくて――
「展望城に行けば医者がいるかもしれん」と
ここまで送っていただきまして、ハハハ――
MsgEn: Ju-just as you can see... I seemed to look a bit unwell, and they, um, thought I should head to Prospect Castle. They said there might be a doctor there, so they brought me this far, hehe...

MsgJp:
展望城を取り戻せて、本当によかった――
やっと希望が見えてきました
ええ、やっと――
MsgEn:
I'm really glad that we were able to retake Lookout Castle――
Finally, I see a glimmer of hope
Yes, finally――

MsgJp:
お、お気遣いなく――
ええ、大丈夫ですから――
MsgEn: Don't worry about it. Yes, I'm fine.

MsgJp: ええ、アデムはうちの子ですけど――
MsgEn: Yes, Adem is our child.

MsgJp:
はぁ――何です？
うちの子へのご用でも、私がお聞きしますから
MsgEn: Hah... What is it? If you have any business with my child, I'm the one to talk to.

MsgJp:
――ああ、あなた
何かご用でも？
MsgEn: - Ah, do you have some business with me?

MsgJp:
少しそっとしておいてほしいんですよ
うちの子が傷付いてるの
見てわからないんですか？
MsgEn: I'd appreciate it if you left us alone for a bit. My child is hurt. Can't you see that?

MsgJp:
私たち、目の前で家を潰されたんです
この子も、それがショックで――
MsgEn: They destroyed our homes right before our eyes, and my child was traumatized...

MsgJp:
さっきからじろじろ見て
一体何なんです？
わたしもアデムも何も持ってませんからね！
MsgEn:
You've been staring at us for a while now. What is it? 
Neither I nor Adem has anything on us!

MsgJp:
ベルタ盗賊団のアジトでお会いしましたね
ほら、《湖畔の洞窟》にある――
MsgEn: We met at the Bertha's Bandit Group Hideout, right? It's in the "Lakeside Grotto."

MsgJp:
アデムも少しずつ落ち着いてきています
盗賊の人たちも気にかけてくださって――
あの人たちって、悪人のくせに
子供には優しいんですね
MsgEn:
Adem is slowly settling down too. 
The thieves are taking care of us – it's strange that they're kind to children, despite being bad people.

MsgJp:
家は潰されましたけど、きっとまた
私がお金を貯めて建て直してみせます
あの子を育てていかなくちゃ
MsgEn:
Our house was destroyed, but I'll surely save up and rebuild it. 
I have to raise my child.

MsgJp:
わたしの息子――
絶対に守り抜いてみせるわ
MsgEn: I will definitely protect my son -

MsgJp: ママ――？
MsgEn: Mom...?

MsgJp: ――なんなの――
MsgEn: What is it...?

MsgJp: ――こんにちは
MsgEn: Hello

MsgJp: うう――
MsgEn: Ugh...

MsgJp: あ、あっちにいって
MsgEn: Oh, go over there.

MsgJp: ママ、ぼくこわいよ
MsgEn: Mom, I'm scared.

MsgJp: ここにいれば、もうこわくないんでしょ？
MsgEn: If you're here, you're not afraid anymore, right?

MsgJp:
デニスおにいちゃん！
はやくボール投げて！
MsgEn: Brother Dennis! Please throw the ball quickly -

MsgJp:
ここに来てから
ママがやさしくなって――よかった
MsgEn: Ever since coming here, Mom has become kinder - I'm glad

MsgJp: ママ、ぼくのことみてる？
MsgEn: Mama, are you watching me?

MsgJp: やあ・仮
MsgEn: Hello, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談１・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 1, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談２・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 2, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談３・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 3, temporary

MsgJp: こんにちは・仮
MsgEn: Hello, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談１・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 1, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談２・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 2, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談３・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 3, temporary

MsgJp: ハァイ・仮
MsgEn: Yes, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談１・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 1, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談２・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 2, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談３・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 3, temporary

MsgJp: へへへ・仮
MsgEn: Hehehe, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談１・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 1, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談２・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 2, temporary

MsgJp: 雑談３・仮
MsgEn: Small talk 3, temporary

MsgJp:
まぁ、覚者様
フェルヤナ一帯についてのお話でしょうか？
MsgEn: Well, Lord Arisen, is this about the Feryana region?

MsgJp:
あら、どなたでしょうか？
拠点の礎であれば
この隠れ家の外にございます
MsgEn:
Oh, who might you be?
If you're looking for the Portcrystal, it's outside.

MsgJp:
かりそめのエリアマスターではありますが
この辺りのお話でしたら
わたしがお受けいたしましょう
MsgEn: While I may be just a temporary Area Master, if it's about this area I will gladly take on the task.

MsgJp:
ふふ、おいででしたのね
展望城、ひいてはフェルヤナ一帯について
何か必要な情報が――？
MsgEn:
Ah, you came.
Do you need any information about Lookout Castle or the surrounding area of Feryana?

MsgJp:
幸い、ここは規模こそ小さくとも全員が食べ、
眠る場所を維持するだけの力はあります
それぞれが力を尽くしてくれた結果です
MsgEn:
Fortunately, even though the scale is small, everyone has the power to maintain a place to eat and sleep. 
It's the result of everyone's hard work.

MsgJp:
この辺りのエリアマスターは
他にいたはずですが――
この混乱の中、行方が知れません
MsgEn: There should have been other Area Masters around here, but in this chaos, their whereabouts are unknown.

MsgJp:
しかし――誰かがエリアの情報を
取りまとめねばなりません
そこで、わたしがかりそめのエリアマスターを
名乗らせていただいております
MsgEn:
However, someone has to gather information about the area. 
So I'm temporarily calling myself the Area Master.

MsgJp:
戦乱の中、たくさんのものが破壊されました
それは家屋であり、人々の心であり――
そしてアッカーシェランという国が築いてきた
文化すらも犠牲になりつつあります
MsgEn:
In the midst of war, many things were destroyed. 
Homes, people's hearts, and even the culture built by the country of Acre Selund are becoming sacrifices.

MsgJp:
そう、例えば《展望城》――
あれは文化的にも防衛的にも重要な城
魔軍の手に落ちてしまったのは
大変つらいことです
MsgEn:
Yes, for example, the "Lookout Castle." 
It's an important castle both culturally and defensively. 
It's been a great hardship for it to fall into the hands of the Demon Army.

MsgJp:
せっかくですから、覚者様も
少し休んでいかれてはいかがです？
ぐっすりと眠らないといざという時
疲れに足を取られるといいますもの
MsgEn:
Since you're here, how about taking a little rest, Arisen? 
They say that you'll need a good night's sleep for times of need.

MsgJp:
《展望城》――アッカーシェランの国民としても
わたし個人としても、大変思い入れの深い場所です
MsgEn: "Lookout Castle" – it's a place I hold dear as a citizen of Acre Selund and as an individual.

MsgJp:
魔軍の手に落ちたと知った時は
心の一部まで失ったような思いを
したものですが――
MsgEn: When I learned that it had fallen into the hands of the Demon Army, I felt as though I had lost a part of my heart.

MsgJp:
ふふ、今は――
ええ、素直に嬉しいものです！
MsgEn:
Hehe, now--
Yes, it's something to be honestly happy about!

MsgJp:
まさか、わたしがこの辺りの
エリアマスターとして正式に認められることに
なるなんて――
MsgEn: I never thought I would officially be recognized as an Area Master around here.

MsgJp:
実は、昔この展望城へも
歌を披露しに来たことがあるのですよ
今度は違う立場で招かれるなんて
人生何が起こるかわからないものです
MsgEn:
Actually, I came to perform here at Lookout Castle in the past. 
It's funny how life can invite you in different ways this time.

MsgJp:
活動拠点が広くなった分
たくさんの避難者たちを受け入れることが
できるようになりました
MsgEn: With the expanded operating base, we can now accommodate many refugees.

MsgJp:
人が多くなると揉め事や悩み事も
増えるようですが――
これも命あってこそのものですものね
MsgEn:
With more people around, disputes and worries seem to increase. 
But that's just part of life.

MsgJp:
覚者様、もしよろしければ
問題を抱える人たちにお力をお貸しください
みな、喜ぶことでしょう
MsgEn:
Arisen, if you're willing, please lend your strength to those in need. 
Everyone would surely appreciate it.

MsgJp:
覚者様、あらためまして
わたしを含め、この村に居るものは皆
戦火を逃れて流れ着いた者ばかり
MsgEn: Arisen, once again, I must emphasize that everyone in this village, including myself, are all refugees who have fled from the ravages of war.

MsgJp:
あなたは解放軍と共に、このアッカーの地に
希望をもたらす方だと聞いています
MsgEn: I have heard that you are the one who brings hope to this land of Acre, alongside the Liberation Army.

MsgJp:
わたしたちにできる協力は全ていたしましょう
まずはここより近い、安全な場所を
紹介いたします
MsgEn:
Let us cooperate and do everything we can.
First, I will introduce a nearby and safe location
for you.

MsgJp:
どうぞ、こちらを――
支援といっても、この程度しか用意できませんが
何かのお役に立つかもしれません
MsgEn:
Please, take this...
Although it's just a small token of support, it may be of some use to you.

MsgJp:
覚者様のお力添えもあり
少しは旅の支えとなりそうなものを
手配できるようになってきました
遠慮なさらず、お持ちになってください
MsgEn:
With the assistance of the esteemed Arisen, we are now able to arrange things that may serve as a support on your journey.
